Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but still great!!”
Reviews.Author: VIAboytes
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but I understand real state is tight in NYC!!! This hotel is conveniently located near times square!! It is great for couples!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice job overall...”
Reviews.Author: HFK865
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of our previous experiences with Holiday Inn Express, all of which have been positive. The price seemed reasonable, and the location near Times Square and right next to the Port Authority Bus Terminal were great for us, since we were first-time visitors to NYC. The staff was really nice and very helpful, answering all our questions and demonstrating a desire to make our visit special. I would stay here again, and I would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “fab ********************************”
Reviews.Author: poppycrete
Reviews.Content: Well my husband and i stayed here for our 21st wedding anniversary over the 16th March and wow, we was on floor 36, our room was done out with baloons and sweets and champagne. Thank you so much. The hotel is fab and close for exploring the city of new york. All staff in hotel were amazing. The ride back to JFK organised by the hotel in a limo was fab. Would defo go back truly a great place. Thanks guys for making our trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “Don't underestimate this place”
Reviews.Author: CherylR31
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the price, but I was very pleasantly surprised. It was a great place to stay. The staff was excellent, very helpful. The breakfast was good, the staff in the breakfast room was always moving and so courteous. The room was clean and comfortable, great bed. It was a quick walk to Times Square. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Peter3101
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its location in Midtown, Manhattan and stayed three nights in March. We were on the 34rd floor and had a city view, which was great. The room was not huge, but perfectly adequate, with comfortable king bed, ample storage and an a bathroom. The complimentary breakfast was surprisingly good: more than just a basic roll and coffee, it included cereal, eggs, fruit, roll, coffee, fruit juice and yoghourt. Reception and other staff very helpful. A useful service was that you can store your luggage with them if your flight is in the evening - so that can give you an extra full day in the city. No safe in the room; only at Reception.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: Angie W
Reviews.Content: Brought my 74 year old Mother to NYC March 8-12. The hotel is a great location-quiet street, close to Times Square and Broadway, and steps from 8th Avenue where you can grab a cab easily! Hot breakfasts every morning-Oscar and the staff were tops! Room had a city view of the Hudson River, Empire State Building and the new buildings near the 9/11 memorial. Very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. The stay was wonderful! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Perfect location!Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Athens E
Reviews.Content: Coming back fro a great trip..I had ro point out this hotel because: 1. Location! I was able to reach everything by feet (location near to Times square, subway/ train station/ bus station only few blocks away)!!! 2. Staff Allways very friendly and helpfull! The biggest plus of this Hotel. I hope the bosses of them are recogniziing this!! 3. Value for money With the overprized Hotels in New York in my mind. I thought that this Hotel (for the price of doubleroom = 150 Dollar but breakfast included) would be a lower service Hotel. But it was not like that! Ennough space, very good equiped (the bed was just great) and very clean rooms! The only negative aspect was the really small breakfast room and the poor breakfast on its own. But at least it was included and I am not a breakfast fan ...just need coffee and a snack in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: OREO-7
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near Times Square so you can walk to everything! Staff is very friendly! Rooms are small but only 6 rooms per floor...so not alot of noise at all! Hot cookies when you arrive too! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent facilities !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Holiday672
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. Free wifi in your room , free breakfast catered for everyone's needs. Hotel staff extremely friendly . The location is great ,turn left to ve on times square in approx 8/9 minutes. Turn right then left and you are on ninth avenue where all the delis, restaurants of hells kitchen are. Would defiantly return !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillyjeweller
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great break in New York - made all the better by staying in the Holiday Inn Express - Times Square. Explained that it was a special birthday treat for my husband and there was balloons in the bedroom on arrival. The hotel staff are all friendly and informative. the rooms are very comfortable and clean and the breakfast was really lovely. We were on the 30th floor and had a great view of the city including the Empire State Building and the river. Very central for all amenities. Would definately recommend this hotel and are already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: crin0
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there for March 11-12 and had a great time. The hotel is very clean, the beds are very comfortable and the staff very helpful. I found the bathroom super clean which was important for me. The breakfast area was a bit crowded on Sunday but we made it work. One block from Times Square and subway access. Thanks to Mike the front office manager for making my daughter's 10 th birthday special by leaving a nice birthday card, balloons and great mini muffins!!! You made her day and ours!! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Big Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Evan F
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe this is the same hotel as early last year. Common areas and rooms are exceptionally clean and well maintained. Every staff person I dealt with was helpful and professional, with the positive attitude I have come to expect in other Holiday Inn properties. These are big improvements over my last visit in early 2011, so congratulations to HIE Times Square for raising your standards. Location is very convenient for doing business in midtown; lots of good restaurants and entertainment in the area. Hotel served a nice breakfast - nothing fancy, but filling and nicely presented. This hotel is a good value for the location, and the people are great to work with - something you don't always find in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hannerrr
Reviews.Content: Where to start.. the staff at this hotel are a credit to the hotel nothing it too much trouble for them we booked a taxi for the airport home and a limmosine turned up for the same price as a normal taxi! the breakfast is superb and complimentory the tea and coffee all day is fab and the warm cookies in the afternoon are a great touch the rooms have a great view and they are small but your only sleeping in them! the only thing i coulld suggest is having a channel guide for the tv =) overall lovely location grreat staff and a lovely stay thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica J
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Holiday Inn Express. It was a quick stay as I had a business meeting in mid town manhattan. The hotel lives true to its name with a quick and easy check in and check out process. The rooms are small, as expected in NYC. The breakfast was satisfying and COMPLIMENTARY. I recommend a change in the brand of coffee. One thing I must mention is the service I received at this hotel. The breakfast staff was friendly and helpful in finding me salt and pepper when I asked for it. I must point out the above and beyond custopmer service that I received from the front desk and concierge. Both Amanda and Nabela were exceptional with helping me when I needed assistance. Amanda went out of her way to get my luggage as the bellmen were not found. I was running late for my flight and Nabela personally went outside in the rain to hail me a taxi. I am one who travels very much and this would probably not have been a hotel I would have returned to due to the construction noise but service like this is what I look forward to when away from home. THANK YOU GUYS!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Spotless and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaDolly
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed in this hotel for the first time after staying in many in New York and it was brilliant value for money. I emailed the hotel before asking questions which were promptly replied to. I had a room on the 33rd floor which a excellent view! The rooms were always spotlessly clean and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was a added bonus and constantly replenished. The location was excellent with times square just a short walk away. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience, will definitely come back here!!”
Reviews.Author: Chantel C
Reviews.Content: The staff and management at this hotel made our honeymoon and our first trip to New York an unbelievable experience. When we told them we were coming for our honeymoon they upgraded our room to a city view and they surprised us with a bottle of wine and chocolates and a card in our hotel room! We were greeted warmly every time we entered the lobby, and every morning at breakfast the staff was cheerful and hard at work. The hotel is in the perfect location from Time Square, Madison Square Garden, all tourist attractions, shopping, restaurants, pubs and especially the subway. The rooms are excellent, very nice and clean! We heard of people complaining about long waits for the elevator but we never had to wait longer than a few minutes for the elevator at anytime of the day. The free breakfast is a perfect way to start your day, I LOVED the pancakes and my husband loved the egg omelettes and cinnamon buns YUM! There were warm cookies in the lobby every evening! Anytime we ran into hotel staff, at breakfast, on the elevator, in the lobby, they were cheerful, helpful and pleasant. Our stay at this hotel was such a positive experience and it definitely helped make our Honeymoon an incredible trip!!! I will definitely stay here again when I return to NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “In the hart of Manhantan”
Reviews.Author: betocoutinho
Reviews.Content: Good stay, fair rate and very good localization, closer to Port Authority Subway station. @ blocks from Times Square. Good for tourist who spent all day out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Whitney S
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was really close to all attractions. In walking distance of Times Square, Empire State Building, Central park, Fifth Ave shops, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Centre it was great! The only places that are too far are Statue Of Liberty and Ground Zero but this was only 13 dollars in a taxi which is nothing. The Hotel service was great, right from check in they were polite welcomed us well and even called up to the room 10/15 minutes after getting up there to make sure we had settled in ok and was there anything we needed. They were always happy to help with directions and recommendations of eating out or which attractions to visit. Other reviews have said the lifts are noisy, however our room was next to a lift and we didn't hear it! In the day when you were up you could hear it slightly but once asleep it was not loud enough to wake up! and i am a light sleeper. Room was perfect size, perfect views and had a nice big TV in. The King size bed was so comfy! We had heating and air conditioning in room however didn't need to use this at all as the room was a perfect temperature! Breakfast was lovely, lots of choice however it was very busy in the mornings and was only a little conservatory where we could sit. We were quite lucky and always got there just before the rush, but others would come down and have nowhere to sit! I can't imagine what it would be like in peak time. The Free WIfi was great as it meant we could get touch with family back home and not have to pay anything to be able to text and ring to another country! Also very impressed they had a workstation area with 2 computers and printers meaning we could check in online before our flight home and print off our boarding passes. All free of charge! :) On our departure day we checked out at 11am but our flight back to the UK was not until 18.45, the hotel looked after our luggage for us whilst we saw the last of New York! :) Will stay here again when we return to New York in the future, which we hope very much to do! :)

Reviews.Title: “Go for the city view!”
Reviews.Author: ssimpson25
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Monday from New York. We had a great time. We paid a bit more for a King Size room with City view - it was so worth it! Our view had been that we would not be in the room much but it was worth it to wake up and go to sleep everynight viewing the landscape and Emplire State Building. Breakfast was included which was great and the staff could not do more to help us. I agree with others about the lift but would equaly say that there is nothing they can do about this - it is a towe block with three other hotels and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes. The hotel was very central and if you have been out for a long day there is a little restaurant and bar across the road that does great food and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: jasperina35
Reviews.Content: Had high hopes after reading reviews, did not disappoint. Started well before we even arrived, emailed hotel to request the three rooms booked be on the same floor, prompt reply confirming requirements and this was honoured at check in. Great rooms, wonderful beds, lovely clean linen, excellent staff, always available, happy to help even though always busy. The breakfast was great, bustling, very well stocked, spotlessly clean. I would like to particularly mention, Mike and Alex on the front desk, unfortunately my mum broke her leg on the first day of our 5 day stay. Coming from UK these two members of staff went out of their way to help us fax and scan documents we needed for insurance and to sort travel home. A very big thank you, a huge asset to the hotel. Overall an excellent hotel well located, with staff probably better than those at the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Carla1130
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how satisfied I was with everything. Not only is the location perfect for our stay, but the service provided by the staff was outstanding. We were right in Times Square it was easy to get around and come back. I must say Alex Martinez at front desk was the absolute best. The attention was sincere. My friends and I felt welcomed. We know now where we will stay in each of our visits to N.Y. I highly recommend this hotel. The beds are very comfortable I must add. It doesnt get any better.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel, excellant service, spotlessly clean, most helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine T
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations having read some reviews! The bedrooms may not be the biggest but were spotlessly clean and had everything you needed for a most comfortable stay. Breakfast was a feast each morning with helpful staff busily keeping everything replenished. Each person at reception acknowledged all guests as they passed by and the duty manager clearly visable checking guests were happy. A most enjoyable stay which will shared with friends and family, and visisted again next year by myself

Reviews.Title: “It's good value in a decent proximity of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: --Roman_PA--
Reviews.Content: It's a quite good hotel on the corner of 9th Ave and 39St, especially if you consider the price and breakfast on the house. It's ok for short stays or Broadway shows overnights. Keep in mind that rooms are tiny and I mean it. Subway is in a walking distance, but if it's raining or snowing, the street stretches and stretches ;-) There are often bus tourists in the hotel, so breakfast room can get crowded at peak. Overall it is fair value, but over a week stay would be overkill. Tip:Avoid at any cost floors with the ice and vending machines - there are 6 rooms on each floor and the machines are awfully loud.

Reviews.Title: “What wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Martininnewyork
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say how grateful we are to all the staff especially front of house. After being in New York for only a matter of hours my girlfriends mom fell breaking her leg. Staff have done everything possible from arranging transport, wheel chair hire faxing and scanning of documents. Really am very impressed and a big thankyou to them all

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tirza_Rapouch
Reviews.Content: One of the major advantages is having an excellent location; you're withing walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, Top of the Rock, Port Authority Bus Station (3 minutes away!) The staff was very pleasant and helpful, the rooms were a bit on the small side but comfortable enough. And it's not like you're going to be spending a lot of time on your room anyway, you're in New York! The complimentary breakfast was of good quality with sufficient choice of food, even for my vegetarian co-travellers. Some comments; - there are only 2 elevators for the entire thirty-something floors, and one of them was regularly blocked for use (by staff?), whilst the other one sometimes had problems to speed up so it would take ages to get to our floor (which was the 18th...) - you could clearly hear any loud neighbours, people walking through the hallways or stairs, elevators making bing-sounds all night long, etc. So bring earplugs - Good thing was that there was the possibility to store your luggage after check-out so you could make the most of your day exploring the cities. And the luggage was tagged and behind closed doors, so not like anyone going to take your laptop from you. - The staff in the entire hotel was friendly and helpful. I especially recommend Jamie for any questions you might have on places to go, things to do, restaurants to eat at. He's been very helpful for us and had a good insight into what travellers want when they have a very limited amount of time to spend in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive location! Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Arulsakthi
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, Great service! Front desk people are very kind! Walk able distance to all the key places in Times Sq. Rooms are tiny but value for money! Breakfast is Good selection! Overall we had nice stay experience!

Reviews.Title: “Secret Shopper Reveals: Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: tantam0unt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance to Times Squares-10 minutes. The hotel is very small, next to it is the Hampton Inn and Candlewood Suite. Holiday Inn is managed by Hersha Hospitality and Candlewood is part of the InterContential Hotels Group. Picture the hotel as a square. As you enter, the front desk is on the left. Some lounge chairs/sofas. Concierge desk + GMâ€™s office are on the right. There a computer/printer station, two elevators, stairs, beverage area and then the breakfast room. Complimentary continental breakfast included for all! There are 36 floors. Ice + Vending are on floors: 8, 17, 25, 35. There are six rooms per floor. Rooms ending in â€œ03â€� and â€œ04â€� are near the elevator. See pictures above. If you were to enter the hotel- on the left side is the view of the Hudson (?) river. The right might be the view of the Empire Building. The checks in time are discrepant: the actual check in time is 4pm. The emergency exit sign behind the roomâ€™s door state that itâ€™s 3pm. We were on the 25th floor-a non smoking floor, but we can smell the cigarette smoke in the hallway. It might be because itâ€™s travelling thru the vents. Iâ€™ve email management for special requests: early arrival, high floor, a room with a view and it was ALL honored during our New Year Eve stay! Iâ€™m just a little disappointed that they never acknowledge that they received my email. Since weâ€™re part of their loyalty program, we received chocolates, water bottles and the staff surprised us with a birthday card and candies. Holiday Inn is a brand you can trust. They have all the amenities you would normally expected-TV, closet, soap/shampoo/lotion, towels, coffee makers, safes are at the front desk. Parking is available for a fee. Complimentary Wifi available throughout the building. I hope you havenâ€™t jump into conclusion about my title regarding bed bugs! There are absolutely NO bed bugs during our stay. Iâ€™ve given 4 stars out of 5 because the lobby, the hallway and the rooms are small. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again. â€ƒ

Reviews.Title: “Great times square experience!”
Reviews.Author: budzina
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I stayed mid February 2012. Firstly I want to thank the wonderful staff. From the front desk to cleaning staff everyone was pleasant, friendly and helpful. All would give a warm smile, say hello and take interest in you -a lovely touch. They were very knowledgeable and helpful which was great as it was my first time to NY. A few great extra touches that I wasn't aware of; I had a room only rate but was pleasantly surprised to find complimentary breakfast for ALL guests every morning. Consisted of juices, tea, coffee, bagels, pastries, bacon and omlettes. A complimentary all day coffee and tea bar with take away cups and lids was very handy and I would take one every day I ventured out to experience the city. The hotel also provides for fast and free wifi. There is no laundry however you have free use of the laundry (washers and dryers) of the candle wood hotel which is right next door. They sell powder for $1. There is no restaurant for lunch of dinner however there are vending machines on some floors with snacks and sodas and water and ice. The location is fantastic! Easy walking to Times Square. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and all the action of NY. Of course being in the heart of NY the room is not huge but it is comfortable, clean, light and appealing. Bathroom is a good size, clean and has basic shampoo, conditioner, moisturizer and hair dryer. The room is serviced daily and kept well. This hotel is great for those that are interested in exploring all that NY has to offer and then come home to a comfortable, clean room. A very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “The good reviews were all correct.”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: Just returned from holiday inn express after spending 3 nights with my two sisters and a friend. Having read a good few of the very positive reviews I would agree that this hotel was faultless. The location was close to Times square. The staff were excellent in every aspect. The complementary breakfast was an added bonus which was a good start to the day. I would highly recommend this hotel if staying in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: denpaulanddan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend break, arrived home at lunchtime and couldn't wait to put a review as we were so impressed. The hotel was in a great location 10 mins from Times Square and Macy's. Staff were cheerful, friendly and very helpful. Breakfast in the morning was constantly being replenished so it was always fresh with a slight variety each morning. The pancake machine was a novelty that had to be used daily!! Rooms were ideal. Previous comments about long queues for lifts and breakfast were never encountered during our stay despite the hotel being full. Our room was on the 31st floor. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: snuffycats
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel Friday Feb 3rd morning around 10:30am and they were kind enought to hold my luggagage while we hit the town. We got back to the hotel around 3pm and they had a room ready for us. The rooms are a bit on the small side but this is to be expected in NYC. The rate of $116 was great. The hotel was clean and the rooms were clean. The hotel and rooms were nicely updated. The internet worked well and was included in the cost of the hotel. The free hot breakfast was ok but nothing great. Overall to be this close to times square at this price there is nothing to complain about. We took the train in from Albany and the hotel was close enought that we just walked the 5 blocks to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Daphna A
Reviews.Content: I loved the stay in thishotel ,'good value for the money ,friendly staff , very clean ; very good breakfast ,as a travel agent I will recommend my clients to stay there .close to port authority and the theaters district. My stay was from January 25 until february 1st Daphna

Reviews.Title: “Front desk - very helpful and courteous”
Reviews.Author: shuebue
Reviews.Content: Alex, who works at the front desk, was awesome in helping me with minor issues I had with the first room I was booked in. It had somewhat of a damp smell so Alex had maintenance put a filter machine in the room for a few hours. The filter didn't seem to help, but Alex was more than happy to put me in another room immediately. He was very professional as well as the other front desk associates, but his kindness stood out. I also used the bell boy and concierge services, and I have nothing bad to say!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and good value”
Reviews.Author: BARGK
Reviews.Content: Very good location - walking distance to main strip. rooms average size. Solid breakfast, although eating area small - need to pick your times.

Reviews.Title: “Exceed expectation”
Reviews.Author: Potakas
Reviews.Content: The title describes my experience. The rooms are on good size for a couple, are clean, quiet and you feel safe. Noticed on previous reviews that many guests had problems with the elevators, we didn't experience any problems even on rush hours (breakfast, check-out). Our room was located on the 30th floor and the view of the Empire State Building was beautiful. The only thing that I didn't like were the bathroom amenities. They do have a nice coffee and although I am not a breakfast guy I enjoyed it. Concierge was helpful with maps, directions and advices on where to go. Also they do know what suggestions are good for each guest. For example, they will check your shoes before suggesting you a place (some guys may find it rude but it is by far better than sending you to a bar that they will refuse entry to you). Baggage storage area worked fine for us and I also found most of the staff friendly, every time walking in the property I had a decent "welcome back" or "Hello". All and all a very nice experience, I would suggest this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_edi
Reviews.Content: Quite big rooms for NY standards and clean. The breakfast was not something great or even average. The location was quite central and the free wifi was very good connection too! I just found the toiletries inadequate since they do not smell nice at all.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is an excellent place to stay - awesome service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: 2 of my friends and I spent 2 days in NYC Times Sq this past Sun/Mon. The staff at this HIE were wonderful. Available, courteous, thoughtful and caring. Alex and Oksana particularly were exceptional. Concierge, parking valets, houskeeping staff - they were all excellent. We asked for extra towels...they were there in 5 minutes (no exagerration). Breakfast (free) hot and appetizing and a lot of variety. Assistance with directions around town - given pleasantly. HIE should be very thankful to have employees that are as conscientious as these men and women. I hope they're recognized and rewarded by HIE. This hotel was so nice, I was happy to walk through the doors each time we had to go back to our room. We have decided to make trips to NYC a little more frequently than we have been and we will definitely use this HIE. The location is absolutely perfect...enough of a walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Just thoroughly enjoyed our experience. Thank you Alex!

Reviews.Title: “new york holiday”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel with my 2 daughters and one of my teenage grandchildren age 15 we were delighted with the accomadation and the breakfast we could not fault overall it was a perfect stay and would return if we ever get back to new york .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Mazza5568
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the holiday inn express from the 5th to the 9th january. The trip had been organised to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Upon arrival at the hotel which we thought was centrally located for restaurants and all the amentities. We found our room to be spacious with an excellent view. We also found in our room a lovely bottle of wine and balloons congratulating us on our anniversary. Which made a lovely start to our trip. We were based on the 30th floor and had no issues or problems with getting up and down with the lift. We found breakfast to be tasty and plentiful with a vast selection. We had made a decision that if the breakfast was not up to much we would dine out. However the breakfast exceeded our expectations. In addition there was complimentary tea and coffee and fruit juices avaliable at anytime of the day which was handy. It saved havibg to use the coffee maker in the room. I had read about warm cookies avaliable and can confirm that these cookies were in reception during the early evening and were truly lovely. The hotel is situated between 7th and 8th Avenue and gave plenty of choice for dining. We didn't like time square in the evening as the restaurants were busy and it was mass produced convenience fast food. However just by the hotel is an area called hells kitchen which has numerous restaurants to try out. We tried several and each were as good as each other. On the day we checked out to return back to the uk we were given the choice of keeping our room for longer or havibg our luggage looked after which allowed us to have an extra day in new York before our flight home. The hotel arranged our transport back to JFK and it made a lovely surprise to be greeted and taken back to the airport in a limo. My husband and I would definitely stay with the holiday inn express if we go back to new York but more importantly we will now consider this chain of hotel in other destinations. Highly recommend the hotel for service, location and exceptional value for money. Thank you for a brilliant time

Reviews.Title: “ok but not the best!”
Reviews.Author: Tisani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 nights, the rooms are clean and well furnished but small. the beds are comfy and the sheets super soft. The bathroom was very small, no counter space, the shower was weak and the water not hot enough ( I hate that in winter). What bothered me the most in the room is the heating system. OMG I barely slept because of it. it is hot hair unit and you set the thermostat on the wall. it goes on off on off forever, sometimes cold air that blasts right at you when you are sitting at the desk you cannot move the vents. cold air hot air, the temp is never right, I had to stop the heat completely to sleep a bit so I dont hear that fan go on off with the draft of it. so it got cold. I know I am talking too much about that but it is ANNOYING and the hot air dries you out completely. It was never comfortable. First morning breakfast was aweful!!!! the breakfast room was freezing like you needed a coat and scarf as if you were eating outside. I didnt understand why they didn't have a heater in that small space. NOT HAPPY. the second morning other than being super crowded super tight space, the place was warm. so I dont know what the deal was. I have to say though the location was excellent close to Times Square, I had fun. The most important is cleanliness and a nice bed, and the hotel had that!..and a warm cookie at your arrival:)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful and courteous service”
Reviews.Author: Said T
Reviews.Content: The first day I arrived (with no reservation) I was treated as a regular client and the nice lady at the Front Desk was very courteous and really made me feel at home. She got me the best rate and handed me her business card in case I have any questions or problems. For any potential visitor of NYC either with a family or alone I woule highly recommend this place. You really feel at home from the first day. Thank you Ms. Villanueva Said Temsamani, Rabat Morocco

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: ronaldvictor
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives you very small rooms, but everything you needed is required. Clean room and daily towels. A minor point is the noice of the other visitors, when you have a jet-leg you will often be woking up because of the noice. Breakfast is ok, while we have stayed there, they were refreaching the breakfast area. The hotel is beautifully located at nearly three blocs away from times sqaire, about a 15 minutes walk towards 5TH Av. But it will take you about a 75 minutes walk to battery park. Anyway good location, nearby, ten minutes slow walking, to get on times square, where you cane eat in many resto's.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but cold or noisy.”
Reviews.Author: finca59
Reviews.Content: I had to stay for 5 nights in this hotel on a business trip. The hotel has defined special rates with the company I work for. Otherwise I wouldn't have selected it. The room is ok and clean. Considering the fact that the hotel is located quite centrally in Manhattan the price is also ok. During my stay in January it was quite cold. In the first night the heating system didn't work at all. In the morning the room temperature was 13Â° Celsius. When I left the hotel at 07:30 in the morning I asked at the reception for fixing the heating mentioning the very low temperature in my room. When I returned to the hotel at noon the heating still didn't work. I had to ask a second time for fixing the heating. During the night you have to turn off the heating because of the noise of the fan. But despite I turned the heating off the fan went on from time to time for a short time. What was very unpleasant and it disturbed my sleep considerably. After the second night I again had to complain about the heating but they were not able to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ! Service Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Lulu390
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NYC before, I was very wary of some of the hotels I researched after reading the reviews. So having decided on this hotel my daughter and I were not disappointed. It was very clean, comfortable and in a great location for everything. The breakfasts were superb with plenty of choice for everyone and sets you up for a day of sightseeing. The staff could not do enough for us. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Kikistreamer
Reviews.Content: We chose this affordable hotel when we visited NYC to take two 4 yr olds to American Girl! The rooms were neat and clean -but small if you have excited children : ). The breakfast was good and the staff was helpful whenever we asked for assistance. I would caution you regarding the "Time Square" label....it is really located in Fashion District. So if you want to be "in Time Square" this location may disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “"Clean and Convenient"”
Reviews.Author: Beardancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to Time Square. The rooms are a good size for a New York City room. The desk staff were very accommodating and the morning breakfast was yummy. It was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “andrea”
Reviews.Author: andrea c
Reviews.Content: ****************************FANTASTIC*************************** from start to finish .staff were lovely . room were spotless . breakfast was FANTASTIC. would defo stay here again on my next visit to New York ...

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KG-WB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay & our first trip to NY! Had booked based on great reviews on TA & was NOT dissapointed. Room was great (although low floor didn't offer a great view but a bonus when the lift broke down or busy times) the 1 or 2 little hiccups we did have (key card not working & hotel services knocking on our door, mistakenly, at 11.30pm) were dealt with quickly & efficiently by staff. Some of the front desk staff were friendlier than others but all very proffessional. Room was clean & tidy everyday on return. Free breakfast was excellent our compliments to the chef! The hotel is in an excellent location minutes away from times square & broadway & just 2 blocks from the transport to anywhere hub. Free wi-fi was great enabling us to update family & friends of our holiday. We will definately stay again when we return to NY in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Crellinator
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly staff. The free breakfast was the best I have had yet at a Holiday Inn Express. Rivals a paid breakfast from a regular Holiday Inn. The rooms are small but typical of New York. Super clean. Easy walking distance to all major midtown locations. Only complaint is that the elevators are painfully slow and take way too long during the morning rush.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: geraldToronto
Reviews.Content: Great experience through and through. I had a problem checking in (reservation made and confirmation number provided but no record on file. Always keep your emails and confirmation number). This was the only negative of this hotel. Highlights: Breakfast in the morning was outstanding. Tasty and kicked off the day well. The staff couldn't do enough for any request you had. Nice room. Cosy, but more than adequate. Warm cookies at 5pm! Rock on. Great proximity to Times Square and subway on 40th (which is the closest station and you can pathway underneath the surface away from the elements). Subway takes you anywhere. Must eat at Carmines but be careful they are the largest portions ever. AND the food is exceptional. Must shop at Century 21; awesome (this from a guy!!) Enjoy this great city. Stay here for great value. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic staff and excellent location!" Lisa, Jimmy and family”
Reviews.Author: windstar022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this holiday Inn for 3 nights and enjoyed all of it! The staff there were super friendly and very informative; especially my friend, Alex at the front desk! He gave us his excellent knowledge of restaurants, tours to take and answered all of our questions with class!! Great hot and cold breakfast every morning and we could not ask for a better location; right around the corner from times square! The rooms were small but as we know, when you have 2 double beds in the room, this is how it is. The beds were very comfortable as well. We were so amazed that when we got there on Jan.2nd, we did not see 1 confetti on the ground in Times Square...wow! I love everything about New York... and I will definately stay again at this Holiday Inn, HANDS DOWN!!! Thank you, Alex from your Montreal friends!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Management/Staff, Great Value, & Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ana V
Reviews.Content: My parents and I have stayed in this particular Holiday Inn during our Christmas vacation in December 2011 from North Carolina. We are very impressed by the professionalism of the staff, particularly the Hotel Manager, Ms. Juicy Villanueva who went above and beyond her call of duty to accomodate us, and make our experience truly memorable. She is an ANGEL! In addition, the rates are reasonable; complimentary breakfast is excellent; the rooms are cleaned/nice/stylish, and the location is superb! It is right in the heart of Times Square. My family and I would definitely welcome another amazing experience in this hotel. We highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: gidge89
Reviews.Content: We booked the Holiday Inn Express Times Square for New Years. It was a fantastic location - a quick 2-3 block walk to the Times Square area and was just slightly off the beaten path, so it was fairly quiet. Our floor (13) only had six rooms on it...not sure how the other floors are, so we didn't hear a whole lot from the other guests on our floor. We ran our fan all night, so any street noise was minimized also. We also walked to Bryant Park and the Macy's area, a little farther walk, but nothing terrible. Subway station was 2-3 blocks away that could take you to Central Park, Grand Central, Wall Street...just about anywhere. If you don't want to eat in Times Square at the chain restaurants, there were lots of restaurants on 9th Avenue to try. Our favorite was Southern Hospitality. Amazing fish tacos, ribs, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and cornbread! About a 10 minute walk from the hotel up on 45th or so? Can't remember the exact cross street. Five Napkin Burger is also on 9th, was too busy when we tried to go there. Pinkberry is also on 9th Avenue...fantastic frozen yogurt! Shake Shack was on 8th Avenue on 41st Street or so? The hotel room was small, but I think most all hotels in NYC are unless you pay big bucks. It was clean and comfortable and that was all that mattered since we didn't spend much time in the room. Breakfast was free - pancake maker, juice, coffee, milk, yogurt, eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, oatmeal, muffins, bagels, toast...couldn't complain. It was always busy, but was fine. Front desk was friendly, they had a concierge that answered all our questions. Safe deposit boxes were located at the front desk if needed. They accomodated our late check-out and stored our luggage when we arrived cuz our room was not available yet. Only two elevators and there were definitely peak busy times where it took a little longer, but overall, that was fine also. The only thing we had problems with was regulating our room temp to please everyone - otherwise, we had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: essexgirlSurrey
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London on the 28th Dec and we had booked two rooms as it was my sons 22nd birthday whilst we were in town. It was our first trip to New York and the hotel was ideally situated right in the heart of everything that was happening. We asked for adjoining rooms on a high floor and we had two rooms on the 26th floor - for 5 nights. The rooms were ideal and had everything in them that you need for a short break - there are only 6 rooms on each floor and there are ice machines and vending machines on four of the floors. There are only 2 lifts so you may have to wait a couple of minutes at peak times. Breakfast was good and plentiful - staff were constantly replenishing items and were more than happy to help out. Definitely worth the money ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Front Desk, and Clean. Great place to stay Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Adrew13
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel and was very happy with everything. Close to all NYC has to offer. Clean hotel with great views of the city. Front Desk staff could not have been more friendly. Jamie at the front desk is very helpful! Rooms are small but it is NYC. Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: As a planner for a hotel in StL I know how important a good team is for a hotel to be successful and this hotel has it! From the room to the breakfast to the amazing staff I was sooo pleased! I had never been to NYC and was with my 2 best friends; this is when Jaime became a HUGE help! As a front desk clerk he was so enthusiastic and helpful! He suggested mulitple places for us to eat and drink for our first evening out! The bellmen were super polite and always willing to help with our bags and storing things while we were out on the town! At first glace, the breakfast room seems crowded and crazy but the line moves quickly and the food is delicious and hot! Our room was spotless and when I asked for more lotion and shampoo it was there within minutes! The location was fabulous as well with the bus station directly around the corner and the subway literally a block away. We could pop to anywhere we wanted in the city in a flash! And, as I mentioned before, never having been to the city the front desk was again very helpful in telling us which lines to take and how to get our money's worth while in town. This hotel is a wonderful place to stay with a courteous staff and a yummy breakfast! I would recommend this to any and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Quite adequate.”
Reviews.Author: Rosie8302
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn. No bed bugs! We checked before staying on the first night. Not the most salubrious area of NY but lose (walking distance) to all requirements - theatres, shopping, subway, eating. The room was pokey - VERY but we had everything we needed. Breakfast was quite adequate, though the use of disposable plates/cutlery, became frustrating! Staff were amazingly polite and helpful. We called the front desk when we didn't have hot water GeForce a shower, but it was fixed ASAP and the engineer came to the room and apologised for the inconvenience. Not sure where the coffee/tea making facilities were meant to be used! But we ended up with it in the bathroom! Very little space or anything of that nature - again, plastic cups! Good hair dryer supplied, plenty of access to mirrors too -,used to make the room appear bigger, I'm guessing. Like many hotels - the main lighting was poor but we weren't in the room that much. Overall quite adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: ruth j
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank you and all the staff at hotel for their excellent service to us during our stay with you. My mom would personally like to express her thanks as do I for her birthday card, balloon and bottle of red wine left in our room, we were overwhelmed and very touched by your wishes. We were made to feel at home from the very beginning of our stay and were helped in every way possible. We did not want to leave! We would happily stay with you again. The complimentary breakfast was delicious as were the cookies and chocolates. The use of the internet enabled us to stay in contact with home and check all our fight details resulting in a stressfree holiday. Everyone was extremely frindly and helpful. Thank you again for such a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, excellent price, super-helpful staff !”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMe9
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five days on a business trip, and it was an excellent choice. Located one block from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, and three blocks from the array of restaurants and entertainment venues on 42nd Street, this hotel is a great value and is within an easy five minute walk of Times Square. While the room itself was compact, it wasn't too small, and considering the pricing at other hotels that may have had bigger rooms, it was fine. One doesn't come to NYC to sit in the hotel room anyways ! The complimentary breakfast on the main floor was plentiful, and there were always at least three or four staff refreshing the supplies and cleaning and straightening up the breakfast bar, and chatting with the guests to ensure that they didn't need anything. The pancake machine was a big hit, not only as a novelty, but as a food source. If you come down for breakfast within the last 30 minutes, yes, you may have a hard time finding a seat, as other posters have said. I came down for breakfast each day at about 8 am and at least half the seats were empty at that time. There is a business center in the lobby with two computers and a printer, that can be used by the hotel guests. The hotel also has wired and wireless internet in the rooms. The hotel has only two elevators, but that only seemed to be a slight inconvenience at breakfast time - it did sometimes take 5 minutes to get an elevator at 8 am, but once there, the elevators were very fast. The hotel is very tall and very skinny. Seriously, I think the hotel itself is probably only 50 feet wide. On my floor, I think there were only six or seven rooms. The hotel appears to be almost new, I would guess about 2 years old. If you are leaving the hotel and taking a cab, I would suggest that you walk down to the corner, to catch a cab, as opposed to catching it right in front of the hotel. Unfortunately delivery trucks etc. sometimes temporarilly blocked 39th St, meaning that you sit in a cab with the meter running, not going anywhere. (That happened to me twice - nothing to do with the hotel, just a suggestion to save you money.) The hotel manager could be seen each morning visiting with guests in the breakfast area, checking to make sure the stay was enjoyable. The manager was very friendly and it is obvious that he and his staff truly do care about their guests - I travel a great deal for work (92 nights last year), and it was refreshing to experience a hotel with that much hospitality and care about their patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Does all you want for the price”
Reviews.Author: tomgem_lond
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 days, and had no problems at all. A room with a kingsize bed was just big enough, room to store bags and a few shopping bags as well. Only having 2 lifts never really caused a problem, it was only ever a couple of minutes wait at peak times. The hotel itself is well located, accessible from both the penn station and times square stops with a short walk , and just round the corner from the port authority bus terminal. The breakfast was always plentiful and well topped up, it got a little hectic at peak times, but it soon eased and we always got a table. Hotel staff were always helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “best value for the money & the purpose of the trip”
Reviews.Author: Edith C
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for a mini reunion of classmates-my 1st time in NYC,wanted to see NYC decorated for Christmas,we choose Times Square for walking convenience to nearby attractions..this hotel fits the bill..the complimentary breakfast was very much appreciated..there was ample selections,the staff constantly replenishing the food,never let it get empty..the highlight= a limo that took us to JFK for our flight home,thanks to Juicy-very friendly & helpful lady --we reserved a vehicle -thought we will get a van or SUV--a pleasant ending for a wonderful trip ..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff/Breakfasts/comfort”
Reviews.Author: sheila_dancer
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend took our daughters to Times Sq, this hotel was perfect for us , yes the bedroom was small but if you want perfection go to a posh hotel, Great big thanks to Waiter Oscar who was the kindest helpful man ever, also to our chambermail (Alex!! room1603) we left her a total mess each day as we were 4 women in 1 room and came back to a lovely room every day. We will be coming back, it was perfect location and quiet at night, thank you .

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dashingdave
Reviews.Content: Very good service, always helpful and friendly. Free coffee and tea service is a nice touch. 5 min walk from the main Times sq. Only been refubished/built 2 yrs ago so still at a high standard. Would stay there again, and I am picky!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and Professional employee”
Reviews.Author: sima s
Reviews.Content: this was my first time being in holiday inn and I enjoyed a lot, great location ,free breakfast and beautiful view from my 23th floor ,nice and updated room and more important lovely front desk staff specially Ms. Juicy I like to send my special thanks for all of her help ,Holiday Inn must be proud to have such a nice and helpful people like Ms. Juicy. I will definitely come back and highly recommend to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “business stay...turned pleasure..”
Reviews.Author: Cari H
Reviews.Content: this was by far the best service I have ever received at a hotel... anywhere. I have stayed in New York at high end hotels with poor service. By the end of the first day felt like i was at 'home'. Breakfast food and service are outstanding...front desk staff are awesome, location is fabulous! I live in the mid west, these people are just like my neighbors at home! travel 50-75 days a year for business. Best service ever in a hotel.I will be back for our annual convention and always stay here. close, convenient and safe. everyone is nice.

Reviews.Title: “No way”
Reviews.Author: Sydneyskye
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a big disappointment to myself and my husband - two lifts and no lifts for the staff so of a morning to go and get breakfast the wait for the lift could be up to 20 minutes - just terrible - The rooms were so small and the noise from the construction sites around the area was so loud you could not leave your window open - even though the window only opened up a tiny bit you could not get any air in the room. The breakfast was good value for money, however I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: JLM_1982
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and a good size. Free breakfast was great, especially the pancake machine! Be aware of the lifts though! At peak times (8.30-10.30 am) the take ages to arrive. I was on the 24th floor and gave up most mornings and walked down. Very close to times square and theatres. Also very close to subways that will take you anywhere else you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: farandaway54
Reviews.Content: Our family (4 adults) just returned from a long weekend spent in New York City and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express. The location is very convenient to Times Square and the subway system. The stay included a free breakfast buffet and free coffee and juices all day. Although the rooms are very small (4 people in two double beds), the staff is very accommodating and attentive to guests needs. We felt the overall value and close proximity to all the theatres outweighed the negatives. Consider staying here if you are on a budget; after all with so much to do and see in New York City who spends that much time in the room anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in new york, but what helped was the hotel, the staff were very kind and helpful, the rooms were cleaned and beds made every day, free breakfast monday - friday, free wifi, great location, cannot fault this hotel at all. Will definately staff here again when I go back to New York

Reviews.Title: “great location and good value for being in manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: kr301
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for about 10 days before flying back to the UK and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! First up, the hotel is in a great location, right next to times square, broadway and penn station. Rooms are small, but thats expected in the type of hotel it is! They are very comfy rooms though and clean! Free Wifi is also available! Staff were friendly enough but only really spoke to them at check in/out. Only problem we had was the breakfasts... which were very nice but it was always so busy that there would be nothing left! And I don't know whether it is because I'm British and enjoy a good queue but it was more or less a free for all and people would fight to get the food! But apart from that the hotel is great value and definitely a good place to stay especially for young couples!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location, good price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: RickStone70
Reviews.Content: Just what we expected. A decent hotel a couple of blocks from Times Square. Basic, but clean rooms with wifi and a hot breakfast included. Would definitely recommend at a good rate. Only real issue was slow elevators! Friendly, courteous staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location not far from Times square and 42nd st subway. Not on a flash street but certainly no problems. Stayed in a king room on 33rd floor with city view. Room was clean, warm and had everything you would need. Shower was great. Staff friendly and very helpful. The thing that topped it for us was the lovely free breakfast which set us up for the day and the 24 hour free tea/coffee making facilites. Breakfast room can be busy, but no problem. Were worried about busy lifts, but found we didn't have to wait long. Internet cafe useful. Would certainly recomend this hotel for anyone travelling on a budget, would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Aaron S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 5 minutes from Times Square and is ideally located for the Empire State Building, Grand Central Station, the Highline and Hell's Kitchen flea market. The hotel itself is spread over 30 (ish) floors, with just 6 rooms per floor. One downside is that there are only two lifts, so at busy times you may have to wait 5 minutes for a lift to arrive, but it's not a major inconvenience. The breakfast is pretty good, with a 1 minute pancake machine, coffee/tea, hot and cold self-service choices. Plus it's a buffet, so you can eat a good breakfast to set you up for the day. The dining area is tight for space, so get there early. The room itself is tight for space, but you get the usual facilities: two queen size beds, tv, iron and ironing board. I paid for a better view, on the 26th floor looking south towards the Hudson river. Otherwise, you're either looking across the street to a building, or behind the building is just the wall of the building backing onto the hotel. But you don't want to spend too much time in the hotel as there's so much to see and do. My only proper gripe is the choice of car service Holiday Inn Express used when we requested a car for the airport. The car itself was a Toyota Avalon, but the driver played loud music, dressed inappropriately, and drove like he was on a mission.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: JimF1935
Reviews.Content: Relatively new. Small, but comfortable room. Free wifi. Good free breakfast. Housekeeping left something to be desired. Dod not replace proper towels, etc.even when we asked

Reviews.Title: “Good location, curteous staff”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMomVa
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just off 5th Avenue about 2 blocks from Times Square. Close enough to be convenient, but far enough to provide some peace and quiet. We were on the 4th floor, and I was worried the street noice would be a problem, but once we closed our privacy curtain, I really didn't hear anything. The rooms are very small, we had two double beds. But it was clean and comfortable. All of the expected amenities. The breakfast, included, was fresh and delicious. My husband was skeptical and prepared to be disappointed. When we left he declared we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising!”
Reviews.Author: Dalpilk86
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and pleasant, rooms were a lot bigger than expected after reading the reviews on here. Breakfast was a brilliant addition and we found a table easily every morning. Brilliant variety that set us up for the day, beautiful pancakes! Lifts can be a nightmare but hard to do anything about in a 36 floor building, just be patient! Free wi if and a computer available for anyone's use. Only downfall which is out of the hands of the hotel was the building across from the road having a restoration in which builders started as early as 4am which caused several sleepless nights so if your a light sleeper ask for a room on the opposite side of the building. Excellent location two min walk from times square subway

Reviews.Title: “Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: As a priority club member for many years..My experience was quite opposite from some of the comments. The breakfast was great and we were able to find a table each morning. The room size was actually larger than other hotels i've stayed in and room size exceeded my expectation for NYC. The room was clean...so clean to the point the maid THREW away my new U.S. Today newspaper the first morning that was NOT in the trash. The next night as I am packing I am missing 3 shopping bags of newly purchased clothes, including a large RED American Girl Bag. I went downstairs and reported to your front desk who apologized and were going to review with housekeeping Mgmt first thing the next morning for next steps as was told the garbage was already to the curb. As I am heading back to the elevator I notice the huge laundry bins and walk back there and find a large trash bin and my daughter happened to recognize our pizza box. I go get your front desk staff ...Guess what? Inside that large clear garbage bag is My 3 bags of newly purchase clothes right there on top of the pile of garbage. Having to dig through the garbage was bad, but what is most disapppointing the management has not bothered to follow up with an explanation to me and I had to explain the situation again at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Our Great Holiday 2011 Pibrochmac”
Reviews.Author: Alastair M
Reviews.Content: I would like to take time out to recommend the Holiday Inn Express, Times Square,NewYork. We had a great time. The Hotel staff were first class very helpfull and looked after us very well during our stay Iwould highly recommend future visitors to stay with you near to all the main attractions also the breakfast set you up for the day.We are allready planning our next visit to your City and will certainly be staying at Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrawarner
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. We were celebrating 2 birthdays and a recovery from cancer and when we arrived our rooms were decorated with balloons and chocolates! Good buffet breakfast with free tea, coffee and water available. Close to Times Square but never noisy and close to lots of attractions. Only 6 rooms to a floor so not noisy with people coming and going. Housekeeping staff helpful with clean towels every day. We were able to leave our bags in storage on our last day. Rooms were a good size with plenty of room as was the bathroom with a brilliant shower! Breakfast room was a bit small for the size of the hotel but we always got a table. Overall a lovely experience - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pantolady
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean and tidy and provided a good buffet breakfast to start your day. Free tea, coffee and water available at all times as well as a coffee maker in your room. Staff very helpful and even decorated our rooms as we were celebrating a 21st, 50th and recovering from cancer. near to all amenities including Times Square but far enough away not to be noisy. We were on the 31st floor and only 6 rooms to a floor which we found good. Lifts not too bad but would be better with one more. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of the action”
Reviews.Author: Kule Dude
Reviews.Content: Staff on front desk were very good - both at check in and out. They arranged for my bags (including computer) to be stored safely during the day and also organised taxi back to the Airport. A previous reviewer had remarked on the elevators being insufficient for the number of rooms - I certainly agree with this! Luckily I was on the second floor (of more than 30) - or British first floor - and when the lift didn't materialise it was an easy matter to take one flight of stairs. The rooms and bathroom was small, but adequate, with a coffee machine included as well as the usual desk and TV. Biggest problem was the aircon/heater. I was using the latter as I had arrived at lunch time on the day of the "big storm" ... many inches of snow. When operating the heater was very noisy - certainly too noisy to use at night when sleep would have been impossible. Breakfast selection was excellent with both cooked and cold items. However, the experience rather marred by the cramped breakfast room having to cater for so many people - AND cutlery and plates all plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Small Big Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Egyptian-Advisor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is considered a small in a big city like NY. the location is brilliant mostly close to everything and close to port authority 42nd street station in which you can connects from there to every other location in NY as well as the Airports. very close to the tunnel which will carry you to NJ as well. The rooms are nice/tiny/clean. staff are friendly but the reception area is limited especially when you are having people checking in/out which is most of the day time. Prices are slightly high but so are all Times square hotels. If you are taking a room with the city view over the 30th floor just be aware that on weekends their is a club on the top of a close building so you will be hearing some nice music :)

Reviews.Title: “New York New York!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gops15
Reviews.Content: Given the fact that you are in Manhattan and the space availibity, the hotel was good. We were in a group with 3 couple and a kid and had 2 rooms for us. The rooms were small as expected. The check in was quick. As it was a express chain, in NYC, every inch of space was a premium. We could see the empire state from on of the windows. The location of the hotel was very nice. Close to times square and all the major attractions. The breakfast area was congested and could not accomodate a large gathering. The breakfast quality was good. Esp the cinnamon rolls. The vending machines did gave out incorrect choices of beverages. however the hotel management did refund the money for the same. Its a very good hotel if you need it just to sleep in, but I guess thats all you would do when you are in Manhattan. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pattiWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is not a luxury hotel, but it provides quiet, clean accomodations close to Times Square and other tourist areas in New York City. The lobby is tiny and cramped (which leads to major congestion during the complimentary breakfast hours). Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our toilet one morning at 8 am, and, after one call to the front desk, it was fixed in 5 minutes.There are only 6 rooms per floor and they are not spacious, but all we needed our room for was to sleep (and bonus, the beds were comfortable!). All in all, we enjoyed our time at the Holiday Inn and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: Hsuth
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights before heading down to Miami in October. Neither of us had ever stayed in New York before so we had no idea what to expect. Hotel is quite small but is clean and safe, staff were very friendly and gave us plenty of tourist advice. The room was also quite small but it was clean, modern, well equipped with a huge bed! We both absolutely loved New York and the hotel was a great base, we really weren't in the hotel much so was perfect for us but if you were planning on spending a lot of time in the hotel I would recommend going for one with a bar and restaurant. We didn't experience any problems with the area but it didn't feel as nice as other parts. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “had a good time, but beware”
Reviews.Author: daniellemomboston
Reviews.Content: well central hotel short walk to most things. room was typical city hotel small, decent breakfast, but beware the day of check out can take a bit of patience, the hotel staff use the only 2 elevators in the hotel, and day of check out, typically sunday can be a wait for the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Basic But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BaggieMark1964
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights (24.10.11 to 26.10.11) at this hotel as part of a whirlwind city break. It was difficult to find a hotel in New York that could accomodate 2 families of 4 in 2 rooms within our tight budget, but this place fitted the bill. The rooms were not huge but there was space sufficient for 4 individuals per room and the beds were very comfortable. The service from all members of staff was first class at all times and the General manager (Frank Cortese) was exceptionally helpful beforehand, giving us advice by email of the best way to see the city. The location is ideal for Times Square and other places of interest and we'd definitely use this hotel again. Breakfast was included although the eating area is small. There being only 2 lifts to cater for 30-odd floors is a bit of a drawback if you happen to be above the 6th floor, but we only experienced a problem on 1 occasion and it wasn't the end of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Sent me to occupied room with man in bed.”
Reviews.Author: KonBon
Reviews.Content: On October 11, 2011, after checking in at the front desk I was sent to a room that was occupied, and as I entered the man in the bed quickly covered himself. Humiliation! I went back down to the front desk, and the lady looked up the room I had been sent to and said "oh, it does look like someone is in that room!" Really? So she quickly sent me to another room, but forgot to change my key card, so I had to return to the desk again. I had a terrible couple of nights sleep because outside my window the garbage trucks were dumping dumpsters of garbage from the entire building across the street. All night long. The only consolation was that I was given a small reduction on one nights stay, but had to remind them of the humiliation I had upon check-in to get that. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You Have Got to be Joking”
Reviews.Author: Kmansc
Reviews.Content: Not sure what this hotel is with only six rooms per floor. Paid $299 per night and had great expectations given its location. It is one of three hotels crammed into one building. Nothing is good about this hotel but the location. Tub had dents, carpet was worn, furniture broken. There are only two elevators for more than 30+ floors and they seemed broken all the time. The front desk staff were helpful but the remainder of the staff was a joke. Tiny lobby and down hill from there. The "breakfast" is help in a back room the size of a closet and not worth the time to look at. Mostly juice and a machine that makes rubber pancakes. There are better hotels out there. AVOID!!!!

Reviews.Title: “basic and fair”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo P
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but very clean. Very kind staff. One of the few hotels in town with breakfast included, and free wi-fi, saves money and time. Breakfast area is small, crowded, and multicultural. Just two elevators for 35 plus stories, so it is better to find accomodation below 6Âº floor and take the stairs. Restaurants and auto-laundry nearby. Theather district at Times Square at walking distance. Expensive, as everything in Manhattan. I recommend it, for a medium budget trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Arnt78
Reviews.Content: Impressingly clean rooms. Expensive(close to 400$ pr nigth), as everything i NYC. Tiny, tiny rooms, but clean. Friendly staff. Ok breakfast, but a very small, crowded breakfast area made it a bit chaotic. Ok location, would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Average Holiday inn Express, a little older”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver11
Reviews.Content: older hotel, small, but not closet type rooms, some room updates.... Not the nicest area in town, but not far from time square and 9th street around the corner has a good selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice!”
Reviews.Author: vokar
Reviews.Content: Staff very nice and helpful. Friendly! Room was standard NYC small but very well appointed. Comfortable bed with new linens, good pillows and great mattress after a long day of walking. Everything seemed very well thought out. It was modern without overdoing it. Nice toiletries, good towels, etc. Colors of the room were inviting, warm and clean. I'm a health eater so I passed on the breakfast but it was a more than your standard bagels, fruit and cereal so for those who partook, i'm sure they enjoyed it. Free coffee all day. This was exactly what I was looking for and I'm glad to have found it. Per night was about $335 with all charges. Note: the neighborhood is on the edge of Hell's Kitchen (Clinton) and while that area isn't as bad as it once was, there is still an element present. There are three hotels on the block so, there are more tourists than in the past but still, I wouldn't walk to/from the hotel with kids or if I were a woman alone. they do have a doorman to hail a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good except for the noise!”
Reviews.Author: shelob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend for the comic con and the place was packed. The room was clean, beds comfortable with reliable wifi service. Service was excellent all throughout. They guided me VERY well on where to go and told me the best place to eat when they found out I was alone. Breakfast was basic but fulfilling. Everything suited my needs perfectly EXCEPT for the noise! It seemed to penetrate everywhere! Location great because it's near times square and near West 46th and 9th avenue where the restaurant row is. It was also a very close walk to the Javits Convention Center where the event I was attending was located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jennie S
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Times Square provided us with great and efficient service. Alex, who checked us in at the front desk was a delight and it was so nice to be greeted so well upon arrival. He also took care of a couple of requests we had quickly. Thank you to all of the staff at the hotel for making our stay enjoyable. We appreciate the excellent service that was provided!

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: a b
Reviews.Content: LIsten, I travel a lot! I've stayed at $30 hotels, I've stayed at $500 a night hotels, this was the worst hotel I've stayed at for the price I paid ($230+). Charlene, the receptionist was horribly rude. Twice my room card did not work and twice when I went down to correct this she gave me an attitude. I guarantee you she was not trained in the hospitality business. It appears to me many of their staff were picked off the street, with no experience in the hotel business. Twice the housekeeper bothered to take her tips I left her but forgot to leave me shampoos. When I called the front desk twice to get some shampoo, it took them an hour and 2 phone calls to get what they missed. Terrible service. BUSINESS TRAVELERS: Stay away from this place,seriously worst place ever!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square”
Reviews.Author: abyssau
Reviews.Content: The efforts of some of the staff were good - but they lack enough power to persuade me to return and thus why it received a "poor" instead of a "terrible" The Staff: "Hunter" the manager - was great (sadly we had to get to know him through complaints) - a true professional, and provided exactly what I expected from a hotel manager. "The maintenance guys"(he had brades) - an honest, down to earth person - good service. The breakfast - is good and better than what I expected and was happy about that "The breakfast staff" was friendly and no complaints. â€œThe front desk staffâ€� â€“ the â€˜very happy guyâ€™ at the front desk was the saviour of the reception staff â€“ the rest were less than impressive. The cleaning staff is as rude as you can get - especially the ones that donâ€™t speak English - they have very aggressive tones, the ones that can speak English are very argumentative. The Location: The location of the hotel was good - since this was my first trip to NYC itâ€™s hard to be definite on this - the one thing that is awesome, is that its around the corner from a dollar pizza shop (@ the exit of the hotel, turn right and then right again at the lights and its on the next corner - go past the dry cleaning shop) The Rooms: Room 1: Blood drops on the floor that had been dripped from the bed to the bathroom. Room 1 and Room 2 - had 2 double beds - "ledge walking" is the preferred method of movement because the rooms are that small. Room 2 bath sink hole was so clogged with hair and no-one had cleaned it and the poor maintenance guy had to clean it with pliers and plungers. I can honestly say, the elevator is half the size of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Check in /Check out...”
Reviews.Author: The Free A
Reviews.Content: Well I had an emergency in NYC and had to stay for one night in the city (Back in June 2011)...So I booked Holiday Inn Times Square because it's was closed to Port Authority... I arrived early to the hotel and as a frequent traveler I know that early check in is based upon availability and I noticed that It was busy that day, a lot of people checking out..so; I told the lady at the front desk ( I barely remember her name..but it was something like Oksana or something like that) and I told her.."I know that I'm early and I would like to pre-check in my reservation"..and she told me that I couldn't do that..So, this sounded so weird for me because most of the hotel do this...and I told the lady " Well it will be easier for YOU and me if you take my info, swipe my credit card, do the paperwork and rush my room..I will leave my bags with you..will go out for a walk and come back later just to pick up the keys"..She gave me the EVIL look and pulled my credit card out of my hands and did what I asked to do it..she looked bothered..OK..So I came back around 5PM and everything was ready... The Room was so tiny that I can spread my legs and touch the chest that they have as a closet.. Anyway..after spend the night I went down to check out and I asked for a copy of my bill; well the agent at the desk( don't remember his name) told me that He won't be able to give me a copy of my bill because I made the reservation through third party company ( Priceline or Hotwire)..???...what the hell .. told him that's it's FALSE because I booked directly with the Hotel and I choose Advance Purchase Rate which means that you reserve the lower rate and paid in advance.. after this he gave me the copy of the bill... About Restaurant I did not see any thing that looks like restaurant... The Area is not kind of safe at Night..there are some bars in the corner and when it's gets busy you can see all this party people hanging out in the street...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: danieloz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in September 2011. Has all the usual features of a Holiday Inn Express being free continental breakfast and free wifi which works in the room. Bed was comfortable but I think the king is actually shorter than a normal king as my feet hung over the end (I'm 6ft). Close to the subway and Times Square. The only issue I had was that breakfast is quite busy and that elevators are slow. When we were one of the elevators was out of service so this made it worse but they did extend the breakfast timings.
