The sheets were not changed when requested with the sign on the pillow or every third day that they claim the change them regardless. Airconditioner was old and noisy, had to be used on auto versus low fan for any chance at sleep (so it cut in and out instead of continuous). Probably would try somewhere else next time. Was also woken at 0400 when the garbage was emptied on the street.

Reviews.Title: “good property”
Reviews.Author: serenitytraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms were quiet (couldn't hear elevator noise, hallway noise, street noise). It was very clean. Breakfast was always stocked well. It is a very "tight" hotel meaning compact. But that is NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Applejacker
Reviews.Content: We needed a one post-cruise day in Manhattan, and with our credit card points, this one was convenient and very afforable for us. The staff was excellent. The location was terrific in that it was within a few block from Times Square, but if you walked around the immediate corner in the oposite direction it was a bit scary at the edge of "Hell's Kitchen". We are big HIE fans but didn't get to enjoy (nor rate) the free breakfast as we had to catch a ride to EWR @ 4:45A. Internet access was fine. The tiny rooms, though, did not have a fridge or microwave, things we've come to expect from a Holiday Inn Express. We would stay there again, depending on the available rates and Priority Club discounts, but at rack retail, too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay even though in miniature”
Reviews.Author: refone
Reviews.Content: I had no expecations when my wife and I arrived at the hotel. We were met by a very nice staff member and were checked in very quickly. When the elevator door opened I saw how small each floor was. We stayed on the 17th floor which had a vending and ice machine. I could literally insert the dollar from the elevator and then get my drink without ever leaving the elevator. When entering the room I saw the same exact room that I have seen everytime that I stay at the Holiday Inn Express. The only difference was that it was much smaller. I was shocked to see that on each floor that there are only 6 rooms, 3 rooms on a side! Since this was the first time that we had been in New York the room was the least of our worries. The room was clean and the internet worked and the flat screen tv was great. The room was cleaned every time we got back each day. The breakfast was the same as every other exspress hotel. The staff changed food out quickly and if you could not find a table in the breakfast area, you just take it to your room or eat in the lobby. I was worred about the elevators because there are only 2 for 38 plus floors. Only a few times did I have to wait for an extended period of time. It was a little loud because of building across the street. I was amazed to see that in the 6 days that we were in New York, the workers added 3 stories to the building. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. My wife and I went to 5 plays, plus letterman in the 6 days that we were there and the location was perfect. We took the subway to see War Horse but we walked to Phantom, Book of Mormon, How to succeed in Business and Avenue Q. We were advised to take the on and off bus which costs $48 per person but good for 48 hrs plus an hour and a half boat ride. It perfect for seeing all of New York! We paid the $29 for the Subway for a week. The subway was just up the street and we went to Yankee Stadium, Coney Island, Central Park and also to Hoboken to see Carlos' bakery. When we were in Central Park we took a Pedi-cab. Cost $70 for an hour. Great deal! We would have had to pedal a bike for $30. We learned alot about the Park and had 3 stops on the way. If you are a middle income person this is the hotel for you. It is clean, it was built 3 years ago, and close most things that you would want to see. We would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need as a base in NYC”
Reviews.Author: emmab72002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid september 2011 for 4 nights as a family. We had 2 rooms on the 5th floor, both quite small but adequate for our needs which were basically sleep and shower. We wasn't expecting huge rooms for the price in NYC and you shouldn't either, but they're not needed. Bathroom facilities were fine, bath and shower all we needed really. The breakfast here is nice, good selection of teas coffees and juices, pancakes, fruit, yoghurt, bagels and different hot breakfast foods, filled us up nicely. Breakfast room is quite small but we always got a table at 7-7.30am, it started to get busy at 8am. There's only 2 lifts so can be a problem if there's lots of people using them but it's just a case of being patient! Free wifi was great in this hotel, good speed and no problems. Good location, about 5-10mins from Times Square and more importantly about 10mins walking from Macys ;) All in all a good hotel in a good location, and we got what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: kazibee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything that you expect from a budget hotel. The rooms are very basic but equipped with all you need for a short city break. We were on the 34th floor (never had a problem with the lifts) and had great views of the city. An added bonus was the FREE hot breakfast every day! Unfortunately we were there on the "hurricane Irene" weekend so there was absolutely no public transport, all theatres and shops were closed and most of the restaurants. As a result all our sightseeing was done on foot and I have to say we could not fault the hotel in terms of its central position. The day we left the hotel arranged a taxi to the airport which was very reasonably priced and very efficient - arriving 15mins before the time booked.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction Not Guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: elnakma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on 39th Street in mid-September 2011 for four nights and my experience was very disappointing. Here are a few observations of my stay: 1) The location of the hotel is ok considering its proximity to the subway station on 42nd Street (5-minute walk) and Times Square (7-minute walk), 2) Friendly front desk staff (especially Alex), 3) Excellent free breakfast with ample variety, 4) Housekeeping staff failed to replace all towels and toiletries even though I called the front desk to complain aboout this issue every single day of my stay, 5) One of the two elevators was down throughout my stay which caused huge crowds waiting to get to their rooms from the lobby. One morning, both elevators were down, and I had to come down 23 floors using the stairs; not something I would like to do again. I tried to get in touch with the hotel manager on two separate occassions, but the front desk indicated that "he was not available". And that was during regular business hours!!! I guess satisfaction is NOT guaranteed at the Holiday Inn Express on 39th Street as the plaques in the rooms indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Z
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel especially the people at the front desk like juicy and jerry. But, I do not like Oksana. The hotel has a nice location

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: WirralHolidaybabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Friday 9th September until Monday 12th September. Check in was efficient, staff very helpful. Rooms bit dated and small. Would suggest a low floor as hotel only has two lifts and gets very busy. Stayed on 6th floor and we walked up and down although it is tiring after a long day!!! Breakfast lovely especially pancakes. No kettle in room but can help yourself from cafe downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice!”
Reviews.Author: lsblondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a six night stay at this hotel. I read reviews before I went, as I booked with hotwire and noticed coments about the wait time for the two lifts. On my stay there was only one lift for five of the days we were there. We only had a note put under our room door once about the problem. Lines for the lift were long and often very crowded when the doors to the lift did open at your floor. We even walked down 25 flights of stairs a few times to avoid the wait. Charlene on the reception desk was very unwelcoming throughout our stay and even gave the wrong computer code to us on the phone. There are comments on here about the plastic cups in the room not being replaced each day, the door to our room had to be forced open by my husband and the bathroom door did not close easily at all. The airconditioning was very old and noisy. These are not new comments, others have remarked about this too. I wonder why people are giving it such good ratings, have they really stayed here? This is not my first trip to NY, we are frequent travellers and I don't like to run places down but the comments I put are true and I am not the first. On a good note, the breakfast had a good selection and was a great start to each day. Here the staff were busy and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: beejay56
Reviews.Content: We ended up here as everything we could find at under 300 was booked. Yes, the neighborhood is not the prettiest and there is construction all around; but frankly, unless youâ€™re at Central Park not all the neighborhoods are spic and span, it's also not on Times Square. It is in the Garment District, and this is interesting - so go with an open mind. Breakfast at all hotels leave something to be desired as I prefer fruit/yogurt/whole wheat/organics over cheesy eggs etc. But, there are plenty of cafes where one can sit and have a cup of coffee and something else... Importantly, the rooms are clean. It is tight but just pretend you are new to NY and you have to redesign this into an apartment :) ! Absolutely ask for the rooms high up. We had a fantastic view of Staten Island, the Empire State Building, and could see the crane atop the new One World Trade Center. At night it was a wonderful view. Of utmost importance the staff are absolutely fabulous, with a booked hotel, lots of demands they were all very friendly and helpful -- all the time

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn quality, extra kind front desk”
Reviews.Author: wandersmuch
Reviews.Content: Alex at the front desk truly made this stay stand out-- a very warm welcome and goodie bag helped welcome me to Times Square. The rooms/breakfast were Holiday Inn standard, fast wi-fi, and even a full tube o' toothpaste when I forgot :) I needed to stay a week, and the prices jumped up exorbitantly for the Labor Day weekend, but I promptly came back afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Nikos K
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very good. The front desk staff made our stay very enjoyable especial mention to juicy fruit. I wont forget her name. You know why. This hotel is very near Times Square. For, us it was always the best time of the year to visit New York City

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmanuelKatarina
Reviews.Content: The Russian-looking checkin staff was absolutely rude and unfriendly upon our checkin. She charged my girl friend's credit card 250usd for car park when we do NOT even had one without informing us!!! A day later we got to know through the SMS alert from the bank. We spoke to the so called front office manager but he did not show any sense of empathy nor did he apologize for the inconvenience they put us through.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO COOL!!”
Reviews.Author: jols85
Reviews.Content: Not fussed on this hotel! good location thats the height of it.. if your allergic to feather bedding steer clear!! The hotel felt too small to cope with amount of visitors. Waiting on elevators took ages!!! when going into the bar, it was like you were in the way.. would not be on my favourite list thats for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MsGeGe
Reviews.Content: We went to sight see and tour the city. This hotel have very reasonable prices. Also the breakfast had a very large variety to choose from. Very convenient location. The rooms are a decent size, but I honestly did not care about that, because we were only in the room long enough to catch a few hours of sleep and shower. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended. I will definitely stay here again, when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn Express with great location and decent price”
Reviews.Author: Francois B
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 4 days in NYC to attend baseball games and as suggested by numerous websites, decided to stay in Manhattan. A quick google of hotels around Times Square led to that hotel; Price was among the lowest in the area, and just a few blocks from Times Square and subway. Breakfast included and ok if you don't mind the crowd in the morning (he quickly got a table every morning, but the place was full). The rooms are small but ok given that you're not in NYC to spend time in your room. The hotel has 36 floors, 6 rooms per floor, and only 2 elevators; the elevators were the only negative point. Try to time your checkout outside of the 10-11:00 period.

Reviews.Title: “Small, crowded but good if you just sleep there & eat beakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: cityKim70
Reviews.Content: Stay 1 street over if you can instead at the Sheraton or the other 3 hotels on 40th.. better hotels and more amenities...

Reviews.Title: “Great find, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Dio1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid July and I can honestly say I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to recommend it. After staying in an awful HI Express in San Francisco I was sceptical when booking but on arrival the room was fantastic as were the public areas. I wasn't expecting a huge room as I'd read that NYC rooms are expected to be a little more compact, we opted for two queen beds and it was perfect for us and the children. There are two lifts which can get busy but if you're ok, take the stairs to breakfast - itâ€™s not that hard (we were on the 20th floor!) The free breakfast was amazing and way better that I've had in other HI Exp hotels (both London and San Francisco were awful), I'd read some of the reviews on here and reponses from Hunter (the General Manager of the hotel) and knew that the pancake maker was a big hit - I underestimated how good this was, we loved it! This did earn us the well deserved nickname of the "pancake family", I could have ate them all day! The area is fine, I may be a bit naive when travelling but I didn't feel unsafe at any time, even after returning from the Empire State Building at 1:30am. Times Square is 5-10 minutesâ€™ walk and very easy, the subway and port authority bus terminal are also 5 minutes away. We walked to the hotel from Penn Station having caught the Airtrain and LIRR from JFK, took just over 10 minutes to walk with suitcases in tow. When we return to New York we will stay here again, I certainly won't be spending time scouring reviews and prices for anywhere else now we've found this hotel. Well done Hunter - keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Book this Hotel!!! AAA+++ rating”
Reviews.Author: JoeyNewyorks
Reviews.Content: Super Clean Centrally located Nice Staff Super clean duvet and sheets Bathroom spotless Will recommend Will stay again Problem: the beds are real soft in all Holiday Inn expresses and its a problem for my back My girlfriend and I are from New York and like nice things for reasonable prices. We highy recommend this hotel. Book with confidence

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: adventurekid87
Reviews.Content: enjoyed' my stay really nice place for passing through or visiting the city when upon arrival was greated & welcomed by a wonderful desk clerk by name of juce! who gave me a brief word to mouth tour of the city & guide & made sure that my stay was safe comfortable & pleasant! i can say that when i come back to manhattan for my next visit i will staying at the holiday inn express time square!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but too far from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Jlocts
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I just stayed Holiday Inn Express Times Square I called ahead a couple times to make sure we could walk to Times Square--well, we could but it took quite a while!! We have always stayed on Broadway and this was quite a walk. After a day of shopping or night at Broadway theaters, the walk was way too much. There were no cabs to be found because of the crowd and the Rickshaw was a ripoff--even more than in Central Park. The staff was nice but the elevators were very, very slow- Breakfast was very crowded but the staff tried to move quickly. The room was tiny- Most concierges were nice but Thurs guy gave us wrong advice. We asked for a cab and a shuttle was suggested- It was slow and went around and around Times Square picking up people until full (about 2 hours) My granddaughter freaked because she thought we were missing the plane A cab or private car would have gotten us right there--Do not take a shuttle unless you are about 3 to 4 hours early. You have to walk up the street even to catch a cab. I would not have let my granddaughter out of my sight for anything. From now--it is better not to go at such a crowded time- We spent a fortune catching cabs back from musicals----probably staying on Broadway or much closer to main streets would have evened out given the fees paid in cab fares- Last night it poured and we were stuck quite far away having to walk back. All cabs were immediately full thus we had a long; wet walk. We had no qualms with the staff--they were nice. Breakfast staff nice--the entire hotel was small and very crowded--

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, moderately priced accomodations in New York City”
Reviews.Author: CJIMI
Reviews.Content: I almost hate to give a good review to a hotel in New York City. Nice, moderately priced lodging has always been scarce. A good review means increased bookings, and higher prices. But, here goes. We stayed here for a night in the middle of August. You cannot beat the location. Just a 10 minute walk from Amtrak - Penn Station ( or the drop-off point for all of the cheap ,busses to New York ). It is also only a block or two from the Port Authority bus terminal, and the 8th Avenue subway. The rooms are small, but well laid out. The HVAC system is a bit primitive for an almost brand-new hotel, but seemed to work well. I slept like a log on a very warm night, as the A/C stayed on just long enough to cool down the room. The windows must be double glazed, as I heard no traffic noise ( very rare for NYC ). There is a very nice full buffet breakfast included in the room rate. The eggs taste like they might be powdered - just pile more bacon on top to kill the taste ! The OJ was not too bad for made from concentrate. I have already booked another night at this hotel this summer, before I wrote this review - and before they jack up their room rates.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it and I am planning my next trip soon.”
Reviews.Author: pedromichael
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in late January of 2011 for 3 nights. We enjoyed our stay. It felt like our home away from home as it provided the perfect home base for exploring the city. If was less than 2 short blocks from the Blue line (E) train and 4 blocks from times square. (More trains available there) The area was safe to walk at night and there were plenty of places to eat nearby including fine dining and fast food like white castle. -Check in and check out was fast -They were more than happy to hold my suitcase for free until I was ready to leave for my flight back home on the day of check out. -I forgot my shaving cream at home and the front desk provided me with a complementary replacement. -The room was clean -The breakfast was just fine, there was good variety. if you dont like eating amoungst a lot of people you are welcome to take it up to your room (we ate downstairs w/ no issues) -There was coffee/tea available in the lobby 24/7 with real (non-powdered) creamer (I was glad because I hate makiing a mess with those coffeemakers in the room) -There were 2 computers with printers in the lobbly for guests to use and the WIFI even worked on our 32nd floor room! -There was a manager walking around during the day so if any issues should arrive (which I did not have) he seemed very approachable. - I noticed a lot of compalaints about the elevators but I did not have any issues. They had 2 of them and I guess people are not used to waiting for elevators. This hotel definalty lives up to the Holiday Inn Express name as it provided all the ammenities they are known for but just slighly smaller rooms (like all of NYC) and no pool of course. I am planning another trip for 2011 I will be back. If you are debating, I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: toolwells
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to Time Square and Broadway Theaters. We paid ~$180 a night for 2 beds (before tax) which is an excellent price for a hotel close to Times Square in NYC. The rooms/hallways were small but from what I understand common for hotels in NYC. With the money we saved on hotels, we were able to go see a few extra shows. However the reason that the price is so good is because the area is going through redevelopment. It is right next to the Hampton Inn Times Square South and Candlewood Suites. There is construction on the other side of the street and the buildings that are left on that side are run down/ empty. However, I felt safe enough walking to my hotel with my 4 and 8 year old at 11 p.m.for the two nights we stayed out late as there were enough regular looking people traveling on the streets. The breakfast buffet was excellent and was a big time saver. One other traveler said there was not enough room in the breakfast area for all of the guests but we didn't have that trouble. The only issue we had was the ice maker on our floor was out of order. Conciege was nice but didn't seem that knowledgeable about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: TheSusilos
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to subway and Times Square. Friendly and helpful staffs. Breakfast was good but same thing for 5 days and dining room was too small.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: CZBrat1977
Reviews.Content: I had the displeaure of staying 7 nights at this location for an event I was attending with one of my teen children. The Elevators are the slowest I have ever experienced and the maids and hotel staff kept tieing them up. the room keys constantly had to be rekeyed - I was on a high floor so it was a real pain to find this out after I wass on the high floor and the elevator was gone. Rooms are SMALL, SMALL!!!!. Housekeeping staff English was terrible and in some cases none. Had to call for a Bath mat almost every day and face and hand towels everyday. Why leave 3 bath towels and one hand towel???? The cups were never replaced in the rooms. Door would stick where I had to use all my body weight to get in the room. I don't mind buget hotels but this room for the price is not worth it. I won't be back to this locaiton

Reviews.Title: “Convenience with Price was Great”
Reviews.Author: JMahaf
Reviews.Content: Came for weekend of shows and walking around NYC. The hotel was convenient, the rooms were clean and staff was very nice. Jaime, at front desk was particularly helpful with quick and good eats close by that weren't chain restaurants. Rooms were NYC small, but beds were fine. When we checked in thought breakfast area was small but they open up a enclosed back area in the morning so there was ample room for sitting and eating. Our room was very quiet for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MichalisP
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Holiday inn Express for 5 nights with my wife. We selected a room with a king sized bed. Room was small but comfortable and very clean. The location of the hotel is very good. It is 5 min walk from Time Square, next to the bus terminal and near the subway. Breakfast was good but the breakfast room was very small and you maybe you have to wait to get seated. The ony problem for us was the price. But it seems that all hotels in the centre of NY are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: P4620
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is great. Room was spotless and like many hotels in NYC the room was small. Everyone at the hotel seemed truly concerned with providing great customer care. the hotel's GM was even happily helping with breakfast while dressed in a suit. Staff was very helpful with directions and advise with which subway line was the best route, etc. I have stayed here before and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jusituation
Reviews.Content: My Friends and I all Decided to stay over the City for the night. It was a last minute thing but all the hotels were extremely expensive we walked in Holiday inn Express and spoke to the front desk I believe her name was Juicy Villanueva not only was she nice and accommodating she gave us at such a wonderful price which made us decide on staying two nights instead of one. overall this hotel was affordable, comfortable and the staff is just amazing. also the location is in the middle of the city which makes travel so much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Yorkiemom19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with a king bed and we literally had no room to even put a suitcase down on one side of the bed. Every time we moved on the bed, the lamp would go off and on. The second morning we had to wait for several items from the breakfast bar. I was really expecting a bit more from a HIE.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: aprilS72
Reviews.Content: We splurged and booked this hotel from one of the bidding sites and so happy we did. We ended up here. We were a little nervous about using one of those sites not knowing which hotel we would end up in but we knew we wanted to stay in NYC and couldn't afford it otherwise. What an amazing little hotel. It was clean, staff were great, breakfast was really yummy and what an amazing location. We could walk right out the door and be right in the heart of things. Even if we have to pay more next time I know for sure where we will be staying when we come back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to rest and start your day!”
Reviews.Author: Francosg1977
Reviews.Content: We were two couples who stayed at this express over a weekend. Breakfast was hectic but perfect little snack to start the day. Don't expect to sit down and have a long breakfast; but thats ok (your in New York you should get moving!) Room was clean and surprisingly large for NYC. One morning went for a run to the east a few blocks and there was a nice path along the water. The location of the hotel is right next to time square and from there everything is a subway or cab away. All in all, this was a great place to stay to enjoy New York.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff and close to Broadway”
Reviews.Author: myfirstjob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 2 years old......The rooms were very clean and confortable. The staff was terrific......We love Broadway shows and shopping and this hotel was close to both.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: mcd056
Reviews.Content: They overbooked and it was a major negotiation to get the room we needed when we checked in, even though our reservation was prepaid and we had first stopped in at 10:30 am to let them know we were there. They also ran out of breakfast almost every morning and managed to run out of shampoo which I had to go purchase myself. Room was clean and air conditioning worked well. Elevators frequently had lines waiting for them.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel and location - taking into account this is New York City”
Reviews.Author: westsussex10
Reviews.Content: If I compared this hotel, to other hotels we have stayed in, it would not rate highly. However, this is New York, and I have to take into account, that people are prepared to pay more to get less, given the location. In this case, the location is within walking distance of Times square (though a few blocks away), Macys/5th Avenue, The Empire State Building etc. That said, the location is not particularly "desirable", there was garbage left on the Street for the first 2 days (it was a holiday weekend), with the accompanying unpleasant smells, and hobos in residence. It was safe though, infact after a (self imposed) 32 year absence, the best thing I can say about New York, is that it seemed very "safe". The hotel itself was ok, a tall slim building, with only 6 rooms on each floor. The 2 lifts were inadequate to meet the needs of guests, with long waits at any time of day. The rooms were small, but clean. Ther beds were surprisingly comfortable. The maid did however, forget to leave adequate towels/shampoos etc, on every day we were there. They seemed to be in short supply, as we were given Candlewood Suite shampoos on our last day. Breakfast was ok, with a large variety on offer. Get up early to avoid the queuing. I personally, would not choose to come to New York again, as I am not a fan. However, this hotel is good for those on a budget (New York hotel prices are unreasonably high), this hotel is in a central, if not the smartest, location.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok - next time we will stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Holiday Inn Express properties in Canada and the US I have to say that this one is just ok. The staff were neither rude nor really pleasant, the room was ok - showing some wear and tear, particularly in the bathroom. The bed was somewhat comfortable, but not the best. As other reviewers have mentioned the location is not the best. It is in the garment or "fashion" district which really means it is sandwiched in between industrial buildings and wholesale fabric stores. It is a few blocks away from Times Square (not IN Times Square as the name implies) but it is still a good 12 block or so walk to most of the theatres. The food was disappointing compared to other HIE's. The biscuits were dried out and they staff seemed to ahve a hard time replenishing the breakfast room with enough food to feed the amount of people that were in and out of there every morning. We booked this room with Airmiles so we weren't that concerned but if I had paid full price I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and above my expectation”
Reviews.Author: LILIK65
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 3 nites on june 26-29 and I can say that the hotel is worth the price as the location is near times square and most of all the services are very good. The front desk staff, the concierge, the housekeeping staff they all are friendly. I noticed that some people complaints about the elevator, the breakfast area and the bed room. However, i don't find any problem at all during my stay. I can say that the General Manager doing his job wonderful. The elevator is fast during breakfast time (7-9 am) i don't wait long for the elevator. The breakfast area though is small but i think its adequate as people leaves once they finish their breakfast. i never have problem finding a table for my family during peak hour (bf time). The 2 rooms that I stayed is both at 18th floor and very clean. The good thing, we did not hear any noise at night as our floor did not have any vending machine. The bed is very good (firmed). One thing that surprised me is that u will always find hot coffee, tea and sodas on the GF (Amazing). During breakfast, the variety of foods are excellent and they always put in more foods once the basket are empty. Finally, I really enjoyed my stayed at HI Express and will definitely come back again on my next trip. Well Done Job for the GM and all the staff there. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: LTerrell71
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. The location was fantastic only 10 mins walk from Time Square. The service was great and the staff were very helpful. The room was a good size with views of the Hudson River and Empire State Building. The room was immaculately clean when we arrived and was cleaned every day we were there. The only slight issue we had was there was no safe in the room, however there may have been other facilities but we did not enquire. The complimentary breakfast every morning was a huge bonus with a good choice of different food. There were also small bags so you could take food away with you. Would definitely recommend to any traveller to New York as was extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: trecev
Reviews.Content: I can say that our family was satisfied with our stay at the Holiday Inn Express. We requested for adjacent rooms since we were a big group and we were getting 3 rooms and wanted to be near each other, this request has been granted. We also requested for early check-in and happily this has been granted as well. Rooms were a little small, but knowing New York we were already ready for this. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were clean. We were very happy with the free WIFI and free breakfast every morning. There were a lot of choices for breakfast and we always left the hotel very full and ready to hit the pavements. There was also a computer at the ground floor for guests who did not bring their computers with them. Front Desk and Concierge staff were friendly and ready to help for any queries. There was an Italian restaurant just across the hotel which served very good food and was recommended by Lonely Planet. Also a sandwich bar just around the corner for quick bites. There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel for diverse choices. It is quite a walk to Times Square though but location wise, it still gives you value for money. Only problem we encountered with the hotel was that the elevator would get quite full during the breakfast rush, we would just sometimes use the stairs because the 2 lifts would not be enough to accommodate all the guests. My advice would be either to take breakfast very early or late just to avoid wasting time by waiting for the elevators. All in all, we were happy with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone who will ask.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It !!!!”
Reviews.Author: alineLebanon
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a great location, close to Broadway ans many restaurants and pubs. The staff was really friendly and had greatconsideration for my platinum status in the Priority club rewards. The breakfast was nice as well :)

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel in NY we have stayed in more than once.”
Reviews.Author: Elly060
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with great links for public transport. The area isn't the smartest but is safe and improving, 4 new hotels hace been built in the last few years on the street, more development is going on and there is a trendy restaurant opposite and in nearby Hells Kitchen. The rooms are comfortable, quiet and with enough storage for 2 of us staying for 3 weeks. Housekeeping is excellent.The rooms are not large but reasonable by NY standards with good quality furniture anf great bed(s). The highest floors cost a little more and those on the street side have really good views, ESB in one direction and the Statue of Liberty in the other. There are 34 floors but only 6 rooms on each floor, there are 2 fast lifts but at busy times you do have to wait. The complimentary breakfast provides a wide choice including cooked items, breads, cereals, yoghurts, fruit and pancakes and everything is replenished as needed. It is self service and very much a canteen setting but it is kept clean and there are trays so you can take breakfast to your room if you prefer. As well as tea and coffee facilities in the room, there are complimentary hot drinks and cold water available 24hrs in the breakfast room. Staff are helpful and friendly and overall this is a well managed, good value hotel that we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkH2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the better priced hotels that we could find on our trip. We took the bus from Newark airport to the Port Authority Bus Terminal, from there it is a brief, maximum 10 minute walk to this hotel. From the street it was hard to see, and once there the lobby area was small. Our room was on the 26 floor, which cost us a few dollars extra. This is well worth doing as there are only 2 elevators and it seemed like anyone staying lower than the 20th floor had to often wait for another elevator during rush times such as breakfast. There is no restaurant, just a continental breakfast. The room was small, but very clean & comfortable. If you are in New York to see the sights & are only concerned about sleep & not spending a lot of waking hours in your room, then you will be alright with this place. I would recommend this place for those on a budget visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: gtasee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a short visit. Staff - great people, communicated well with my group and assisted us whenever needed. Always friendly and happy to help. Location - ideal for anyone visiting, not far from Times square or the subway, walking down late can be a little scary, however you need to just action common sense. Room - clean room, bed was comfortable to sleep in, would say it was a little small, however this was something that was expected and as you hardly spend much time in the room its not a problem. Breakfast - great fresh selection of food, always stocked well - must have. Overall hotel quality - always clean, safe and most of all it was well managed. People who have complained about the elevator - what are you on about? Had no issues what soever. Will be coming back here if I come to New York again. Thanks to all the staff at the hotel for making my stay pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not prepared for the volume of guests”
Reviews.Author: amiejsd
Reviews.Content: Hotel has good location, room very comfortable,bad points breakfast and number of lifts available for the number of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean room and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Spurv
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were immediately upgraded to a better room without even asking. The front end staff (yes, I'm talking about you Jamie) were extremely helpful and accomodated our every request. The free breakfast was varied and plentiful and the room was clean - a must for us. The location was idea for most things we wanted to do and not too loud in the nightimes. The room wasn't huge, but we didn't expect it would be (this is Manhattan after all). It was everything we wanted and more, all for a very reasonable price. We would stay there again, and seeing as we're already itching to go back to NY, we probably will. * Note: I have also posted this review on Expedia.ca where I booked the trip. *

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: amiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over Memorial Day Weekend. The staff was friendly, the bed very comfortable and the breakfast selection was plentiful and tasty. The location was very convenient to Times Square and the subway. The rooms were small, the elevators a bit congested until around noon and the breakfast room small for the number of people trying to use it...but we had already read about that right here so it was alright. We would stay here again unless we decide to splurge for a little luxury on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, almost perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Lovetoroadtrip82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the staff was very helpful. We arrived early after a red eye flight and they were able to find us a room where we could drop our bags off and take a quick shower. The temperature was perfect. The elevators are a little slow for such a busy hotel, but the location and everything makes up for it. The rooms are just the right size for a times square hotel. The only problem we had was after we checked we left something in the hotel room and had to call lost and found multiple times before some answered and even that time we had to leave a message but were assured that someone would call us back - despite those guarantees we still haven't heard back... Even so, would definitely stay at the hotel again, just next time I'll triple check the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: londonwesty
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Expedia as part of a flight and hotel package combination. Chose this hotel because of its value, location and relative condition of the building. The hotel is literally just blocks away from Times Square and the Broadway theatres. Just walk two blocks and then up one and you are at TS. The 42nd Street Subway is just left out the door, left at the corner (8th Ave.) and up one block. The Circle Line boat dock and the Intrepid Air and Space Museum is also an easy walk to the river. Three blocks over and five blocks up. Cabs are plentiful and inexpensive. The hotel has 35 floors and only six rooms per floor. It is very tall and thin. The rooms are rather small but still comfortable. We had two adults and two teens and managed just fine. Room is missing a safe, which would be nice. Bathroom is great and no problems there. Night noise is very little and sleep comfort was good. We could see the Empire State Building from our window. The staff are great and answered any questions we had and called around for reservations and offered tips and suggestions readily. The breakfast room was always fully stocked and very clean albeit a bit small but we always got a table. The staff there were always bringing in fresh food. Lots to eat and a decent selection of hot and cold items. Being very tall and only six rooms per floor the elevator could get a little busy and was crowded, but that was minimal. Would stay at this property again in a heartbeat. We felt safe and secure at all times and didn't feel nervous walking from Times Square late at night, which BTW stays open very late. Just around the corner a good restaurant is the Heartland Brewery. Good steaks, good beer and good coffee. There are several around the city.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic base to stay at in the middle of the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: 190725Tammy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just what we were looking for; close to subway stations, shops, restaurants and a few blocks from Times Square. Set close to the fashion district, it may not be based in the busiest of streets, but after long day, sight-seeing or visiting friends. It was a place, my friend and I, were proud to call home for 5 days. When we arrived in New York, it was good to see Jamie smiling and helping us out in reception. The staff were very freindly and nothing was too much bother. Breakfast was a good kick start in the morning, and complimentary web access was avaialble near reception, to look up places for the day ahead. Before booking the hotel I had read reviews, that rooms at this hotel are small, that maybe so. However, although they are quite small, they give you everything you need for a comfortable stay. Good beds, a tv, desk area and a compact bathroom with shower and bath. We definately look forward to returning here in the future. Its clean, comfortable and friendly. What more do you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, we got what we paid for - in a good way!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthernerInSouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in May with friends; as a fan of tripadvisor I was fully aware of the good and bad with the hotel and have to say it didn't disappoint! The good: central location meant we walked plenty even though our feet ached at the end of each day! Found some great restaurants nearby, Thai Select just a couple of blocks away on 9th is great and there's a great Italian place also on 9th (cant remember the name) where the staff were very accommodating. The breakfast was a great start to the morning, for all those worried about the elevator queue getting downstairs just take the stairs!! All day tea and coffee was great. Staff were friendly, when we requested more towels the front desk called few mins later to confirm whether they had arrived yet. The bad: Room is small and it was a bit of a tight squeeze for three of us, particularly after we had done some shopping! Bathroom was clean but little space to put our toiletries, however we worked around this so it was fine. The room was equipped with an iron and hairdryer - however when we contacted the hotel prior to travelling we were told they didn't provide them so ended up taking both with us. On the last day we asked for a set of scales so we could weigh our luggage - lots of shopping im afraid! Initially we were told they were elsewhere and then finally we were told they couldn't find them. It would help if the breakfast items were labelled, some are clearly obvious but for those with specific dietary requirements a few labels would certainly help! Overall we had a great holiday, this hotel is ideal if like us you want somewhere clean and safe to stay in whilst you explore the city. If you plan on spending a lot of time in the hotel and want the extras then pay more and stay elsewhere otherwise don't complain if you stay here and you get what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “very good - this place is as advertized”
Reviews.Author: sociallyliving
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for us. The rooms are small, but then they didn't promise big rooms. They do promise a free and filling breakfast, and they delivered that 100% every morning! There were at least two staff people constantly refilling everything, everything worked, just enough seating for everyone in the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Small and older style - good location.”
Reviews.Author: Mon_Petite75
Reviews.Content: Location was quite central without being too much in the heart of it - noise and lights were not a problem. Roughly a 5-10 minute walk to the heart of times square. Room was comfortable but don't expect anything too flash. I thought it a little pricey for what it was, however it is quite close to all the action so you are most likely paying for location. Also had a great view of parts of the skyline from my room. Do NOT eat the breakfast here. It is all plastic American food served in a a small university type cafe which is crowded. The only good thing about it was the fresh fruit - grab an apple or banana and go out for real coffee! It was ok, not bad, not great. However, good location. The staff were wonderful and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Professional Service”
Reviews.Author: Schloime
Reviews.Content: Very nice Holiday Inn Express. The best part is the service at the front desk. I needed to book a ride to La Guardia and ALEX was extremely helpful, kind and informative. He reserved a car and I felt at ease. It is a good feeling to know that you are in good hands. I was extremely grateful for his assistance and I appreciated his friendliness and professionalism. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Our trip was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JKBANT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome. We arrived at 8:30 am on Sunday, May 1st. Our room was not ready but that was okay, the front desk girl (Oksana) had the doorman take our luggage and offered us breakfast then we left to see the sites. When we got back at 4pm our room was ready and the front doorman got our luggage and brought it up for us. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were great, beds also very comfortable. The breakfast each morning was also really nice there was lots to choose from and not to metion the great kitchen gentleman that greeted us each morning. Anytime we needed directions or had questions the front desk personal helped us they were wonderful. (Not sure why they have a concierge, I never seen anyone there and one time when there was someone the person was no help but that's okay the front desk personal surely makes up for the concierge) This hotel was close to all the sites and the subway service. We will for sure be back and will definatley choose this hotel again:) Thank you to everyone that help made our trip special!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location!”
Reviews.Author: shahara79
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and of comparable size to other NY city hotel rooms. We followed advice from previous guest review to go with a lower floor because of the elevators. Fabulous breakfast spread - pancakes, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, pastries, yogurt.... Juice machine, coffee and tea available any time of the day. I am usually a light sleeper in hotel rooms but room was quiet and the air/fan stayed on continuously, not on and off all night long like some hotel rooms. So I slept great even with the construction across the street. A few blocks from Times Square in one direction, Macy's in the other direction and close to the Grey Line if you are taking the double decker bus tours. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room 701 is the one to avoid!”
Reviews.Author: VenueSmart
Reviews.Content: Overall not very impressed with this hotel, room 701 is an accessible room which we were made aware of at the time of booking however it's either haunted or needs a maintenance overhaul! The door bell kept randomly going off at all hours and as the room is accessible this meant the bell was extra large with flashing lights! This woke us at least 4 times during the two night stay. In addition drainage was poor and a short shower would flood the entire bathroom and spill out onto the hall carpet which to avoid meant using the towels at the bathroom door as a barrier! Breakfast was very busy both mornings and not enough seating for guests. Finally beware of the dry cleaning service, I checked a shirt and trousers totalling $16.50 according to the slip in the room, when collecting the cost doubled to $33 and the slip I had completed wad not attached to my cleaning but a totally new one with very different prices! It took a while but I did get the receptionist to agree to amend the bill eventually! Overall poor hotel but good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, impeccable room, friendliest staff ever ...”
Reviews.Author: D0lceV1ta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the beginning of May and have enjoyed our stay very much. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in answering all our questions with a smile. The rooms were clean, our king sized bed and pillows were just perfect. The complementary breakfast was also very good in both quantity and quality: omelettes, scrambled eggs, sausages, pancakes, bagels, toast, yogurt, fresh fruit salad, cheese, muffins, cinnamon rolls, coffee, tea, fruit juices, etc. The only drawback to our great stay is the elevator service during breakfast hours. There are only two elevators for all 36 floors and the wait times are long. We found the solution though: press the up and down buttons no matter the direction you are going and get in the first one that arrives. If you wait for an empty one going your direction, you might have to wait a long time. Apart from the breakfast traffic, there were no excessive elevators waiting periods. We recommend this hotel whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant deal for family travel!”
Reviews.Author: HonestMonkey
Reviews.Content: Learn from friends about this hotel. Also read up on reviews from other tripadvisor members. Find the place exactly as described. I like the free breakfast offered, especially with fresh fruits being provided every morning. The room is clean and beds comfortable after a long day of shopping and sight-seeing. The location of the hotel is good because it is only 5 minutes walk from 42nd st. subway station. Across the street there is a Starbuck coffee shop. Even though the hotel is located in the middle of the 39th st., it is quite save to walk back to it in late evening, especially after a Boardway show. Good deal for family visit in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: bunnybugs
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great breakfast but it does get very busy in the breakfast room, however the staff in their and the rest of the hotel are very friendly and professional. It is well located for all the action in Times Square and very quiet for sleeping - we were on the 22nd floor. The free WIFI was very useful for my son and I liked the fact that you can get hot and cold drinks for free at anytime. I hope to go back to New York and if we do we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They have done it again”
Reviews.Author: disneykristen
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel and almost instantly upon arriving I was reminded why. The location is unreal, the staff are super friendly and the beds are HEAVEN. If you are looking for a good base this is it. I mean free breakfast, 2 minute walk to subway, safe to walk to and from Times Square and Broadway at night.. I am actually even planning another trip already cause I love the hotel and the city that much. HUNTER KEEP DOING WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

Reviews.Title: “They should call this a small slice of holiday inn!”
Reviews.Author: Cali_Cake
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying NY is an expensive place to visit! We were looking for a family (for 4) Â friendly clean place that we could walk to times square. We selected this place based on a special offer email we received. It was still something like $160 a night, but we went for it. It's easily the most bizarre slice of hotel we'd seen (not counting londons doubletree) It was a narrow grouping of 4 rooms per floor, and went a ways up. Somsandwiched between a days inn and something else. We were cool with it though until we saw our room! For a family of 4: - the 2 queen beds were built into the walls with a small floating shared nightstand - there was a window ac unit (you needed to climb on our bed to access it) - there was no way to lay down suitcases to access, as there wasn't enough floor space. So we kept our bags packed, and pulled them onto our beds to extract items, then place them back on the floor upright. - the bathroom was unfinished, and had a pedestal sink. There was no toilet cover, so you had no choice but to lay your clothes and essentials on the floor. - maid service was very noisy in the entire hotel(you're right next to exerything) - the free business center is in a basic bomb shell area with no wifi, just ancient desktop pcs! I had to conduct my businiess phone meeting with vacuums and lots of people. - no bar to grab some wine or snacks - there was however breakfast offered All in all.... What you'd expect in NYC. It wasn't perfect, but the price was right. Dirty rooms, good locale and crackerbox tiny! Maid service sucks Wake up call never came

Reviews.Title: “Avoid any floor with vending / ice machines"”
Reviews.Author: sfgc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights in April in a family room on a vacation in NYC. Hotel is in a good location for all tourist attractions and in a quiet area, except for the construction site across the road that starts at 7am each day. Never felt unsafe - even with the family - there are a couple of down and outs outside the Port Authority but it is nowhere as bad as you may be led to believe. The good things: comfortable beds, clean rooms, friendly staff, breakfast, location. The not so good things: impossible to get a lift in the morning (we walked the stairs), the scramble for seats in the small dining room at breakfast. However, at all costs avoid any floor with vending or ice machines ! Directly outside our room the vending m/c made a loud noise all night and the ice machine is used at all hours (even 4am!) and the noise the machine and the drunks using them made woke us up every night. I would not avoid the hotel, just parts of it!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Seattle9294
Reviews.Content: I think the Holiday Inn Express near Times Square is an excellent hotel. The employees are so professional, and service minded. Jaime at the front desk made us feel very welcome and he gave us lots of tips about restaurants and he was helpful about the subway. The breakfast in the morning was well stocked, there was everything we needed to start our day, eggs {3 kinds}, pancakes, toast, english muffins, bagles, yogurt, sausage, oatmeal, cereal and very delicious coffee. The mornings are extremely busy in the eating area and the elevators get extremely busy. The only negative comment I could make is not the hotel's fault, there is a big construction project across the street that start at 7AM, it woke me up 2 times. There are probably 5 hotels that are close to the construction, so everyone is being affected. I wish the construction started at 8AM. It looks like the construction project will last at least a year, so bring earplugs! The internet worked extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for much more.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMandy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week on a city break to the big apple. We couldn't have asked for much better service. All the front of house staff were absolutely lovely & very helpful. Breakfast was also amazing, it's definitely a lot more than we were expecting. Even though while were were their there was construction work going on, the staff made sure it did not get in the way of any of the guest, and once you were in your room you could not here a thing. The manager was very helpful, and on one occassion there was a problem with the lift, he was up there straight away to fix it. Great location, lots of bars and restaurants on 9th and walking distant from pretty much most of the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very friendly staff near times square.”
Reviews.Author: elianarjz
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly. Breakfast is good. Coffee, tea, juice all day long for free. Rooms clean and good beds. I had a good time in this hotel. Os funcionÃ¡rios sÃ£o muito prestativos. O cafÃ© da manhÃ£ Ã© Ã³timo, os quartos sÃ£o limpos, as camas sÃ£o boas e Ã© bastante silencioso. Tive uma Ã³tima estadia neste hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: wff
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay with my ten year old daugher for a weekend. This property is tucked away on a relatively quiet street. We arrived after 2 am and felt very safe walking from Penn Station, which took only ten minutes. The hotel is a more vertical version of the typical HI Express. We stayed on the 26th floor where there are only about six rooms. Our room was adequately sized with two double beds, as big a room as one can expect in NYC for the price. The hotel is as clean or cleaner than any other HI Express in which I've stayed. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The front door is locked late at night and is in direct line of sight of the front desk clerk. We felt very secure. Because it was a weekend, the breakfast room was very crowded around 8:30 am but the complimentary breakfast is worth the wait in view of NYC prices. All in all, ours was a very pleasant experience. I strongly recommend this hotel as a value property. If you want luxury, stay elsewhere and pay twice the price. If you want a clean base with comfortable beds, adequate security, and a good location, you will like this property.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express--Quiet and Central”
Reviews.Author: LMH2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my sister, her daughter and my Mom. We wisely got two rooms and the hotel accommodated our request to place us on the same floor. The room was very quiet and even though we were right next to elevator, we did not hear it once the entire time we were there! The hotel was close to Times Square and near all the fun shops in the Garment District. The breakfast was ample and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient, Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: FamilyfromPerth
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the USA and New York City. We booked online with Expedia and were delighted with our experience. The Holiday Inn Express was fantastic value for money, affordable and really right around the corner from Times Square. We checked in about 6.30pm, dumped our bags and headed straight off to enjoy the Times Square experience. The breakfast was plentiful. The same every morning but enough choices that you could have something different each day. Hot drinks, juice and water were available all day from the downstairs kitchen area, which made having to use the coffee facilities in the room obsolete. The rooms were spotless and the shower head was the best that I have experienced so far in the US!! The only downside were the rooms were relatively small, especially for a family of 4. But we did not come to New York to sit in our rooms - so it really wasn't a hassle for us. This was a great hotel, a lovely experience and will definitely be recommending the Holiday Inn Express to friends travelling to the US.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for exploring New York City”
Reviews.Author: cdsmith68
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was practically faultless, a fantastically run hotel where the staff are more than happy to help with anything you need during your stay. The rooms are not huge, however they are very well equiped with flat screen tv, aircon, comfortable beds and ensuite. Check-in and check out were completed without any hassle and the complementary breakfast provided a mix of hot/cold, savory and sweet options which set you up for a day exploring the city. Yes, it is busy if you leave it until 9:15 to eat breakfast but the hotel cannot be blamed for it being busy at this time (as other reviews have suggested). Tea, coffee and fresh juice is also available throughout the day. Wifi is free throughout your stay along with two desktop PCs in the lobby which are also free to use and print from. Both are extremely useful and other hotels I stayed at were looking to charge $5 for half an hours use. Finally a lot of the earlier reviews talk about long waits for lifts and at times they take a couple of minutes to arrive and can be busy, but I only found them to be busy at breakfast again around 9:15. I would recommend this hotel to anyone like myself who was staying in New York for the first time, it is just a 5 min walk to Times Square and is right in the centre of the Midtown of Manhattan. Very impressed, would definitely chose to stay here again if I am lucky to travel back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mlss0
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms are small but I think that is normal for NYC. The rooms were very clean and quiet so I felt comfortable staying here. They offer a complimentary breakfast that had a large variety to choose from. The staff was friendly and helpful. Overall a nice hotel to stay in and I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: precisionweldltd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and found it to be very clean with really comfortable beds and very quiet the rooms were a good size for New York. We found all the staff very helpful and the hotel was only a five minute walk from Times Square. The breakfast in the morning was really good and set us up for the day. The lifts were no problem. Overall a great stay, wouldn't hesitate to recommend, we really enjoyed our stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: nickiblueeyes
Reviews.Content: Just returned today (21st March 20011) from the Big apple, one word AMAZING. From the moment we arived until we left we had the most fabulous time. The staff at the holiday Inn were very helpful,polite and nothing was to much trouble. The lobby was being re-floored throughout are stay, but it was'nt a problem or inconvience. There are only two lifts, which in a morning can be really busy and you may have to wait for up to 10mins at most for one, and gets a little frustrating but again not to much of a problem. Also breakfast is a little chaotic and we ended up eating out most days for it, but think its a new way for them and has a few teething problems. The rooms are a litle small but very adequate and have everything you need, the bed is huge and very, very comfortable and we had a city view which was wonderful. Everything you need is right there on the door step and around the corner. Take some very comfortable shoes as walking is the easiest way to get around and after a day you really do get your bearings. Overall a FANTASTIC,AMAZING,WONDERFUL experiance and we cant wait to go back!!! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: ImOnHoliday28
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to NY in a space of 2 years so this time I opted to lease an apartment for my 2 week stay thinking it would be more convenient, what a mistake that was. I was left staying somewhere that was unsafe, disgustingly dirty and the door man had no interest in helping us at all. After 12 days in hell we couldn't handle it anymore and started searching for a nice affordable hotel, that's where this amazing place comes into play. We checked in for the last 2 nights of our trip and it left us thinking why didnt we do this 12 days ago!! OK so the rooms are not large like we are use to here in Australia but who really need's a huge amount of space when you're out exploring all the time? The Queen size bed's were amazingly comfortable and the linens were so plush and soft, the bathroom was immaculate and the water pressure was perfect, we had a large flat screen TV and a view of the Hudson River. The breakfast that was included with our stay was really yum and changed every morning so you never got bored. The staff here really deserve a pat on the back they really made our stay and were always polite and helpful. So to all of you Thank you so much!! One more thing Location Location Location this is the place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but real elevator problem”
Reviews.Author: cologabs
Reviews.Content: Ok for the price. If you book early enough you can get a hotel closer to times square for the same amount. This hotel is about 4-5 blocks from Times Square. Our room was not ready when we arrived and was still not ready after 3:00 as promised, however, the staff did get us another room. This hotel is very clean and very quiet. Aside from the location being a little far from activities, the lobby and breakfast area are too small to accommodate all of the guests. There are only two elevators and NO SERVICE elevator. During breakfast time, it is impossible to get an elevator going down. (we actually had to go up and then down after waiting forever). Not many hotel amenities ie.. no stamps, gift shop etc. as found in most other hotels. Had to go down several floors for ice and vending and wait for the elevator. Overall staff was nice and concierge was very helpful. Ok place but for a few dollars more, I would stay more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Grlz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nicely located. It was only a 5 or 6 block walk to Times Square. It was also nicely located for the City Sights bus tour pick ups as well as the subway. The continental breakfast was okay. Nothing special, but there was plenty of food. Rooms were small, but that was as expected in the city. Housekeeping wasn't the best about replacing things, but the rooms were neat & clean. I would stay here again if I went back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to convention center, subway, Times Square”
Reviews.Author: NancyDeVito
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have points for the four nights we stayed at this hotel and were presented with a welcome bag for Priority Club members with water, candy, etc. The Manager, Hunter, is very friendly, helpful, pleasant, and hands-on - visiting the breakfast room every morning and helping us with directions, suggested sites, etc. The hotel is better than average Holiday Inn Express, especially for NYC. Average size rooms for a city (smaller than non-city, of course), but manageable for our party of 3. Free breakfast, typical HIE fare saves a bunch of cash in the city. Just a couple of blocks to the Jacob Javits convention center in in one direction and a couple of blocks the other way to the subway at Port Authority (a super easy commute from JFK via AirTrain ($5 pay when you get off the train, then subway E train direct to Port Authority 42nd st stop--we got a $29 unlimited 7 day subway pass which we bought when we departed the AirTrain). Cheap and easy, takes about 1 hour. Felt as safe here as Broadway or Times Square. Easy walk to the theatres, Times Square, etc. Free wifi in room, computer/printer downstairs, very clean and new looking. Only suggestion would be a guest laundry. We were on the 34th floor and there was zero street noise or any other noise. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location & good value”
Reviews.Author: Rafiki63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for my partner and I to do all New Yorkâ€™s sight seeing, shopping along 5th and 6th avenue and walk to Broadway shows. Central to everything. Rooms are very cozy, clean and hotel staff were friendly and organized. Check in took less than five minutes. It was nice having a huge variety of food available for breakfast. Hotel is reasonably priced. Only negative (which hotel staff were in the process of amending) is that one of the lifts were broken. Therefore most mornings and nights we would have to walk 12 floors because the line for the only available lift was so long. Overall we had a lovely stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bhoge
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is so close to so many NYC attractions! The hotel is clean and comfortable and the breakfast in the morning is always tasty. The hotel is fairly new I think and very clean (I can't sress that enough - I'm quite particular about cleanliness). My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the king leisure suites, which was still small, but it's New York, that's to be expected. We were only sleeping there anyway. The elevator was pretty quick and the hotel staff was approachable and helpful when asked for help. The price was right as well and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a block away from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: Great Location, just a block away from Times Square and a 2 minute walk from Penn Station. Easy access to all areas of New York. Breakfast was good and well stocked, All staff that we come into contact with was professional and helpful, espically on check in, Jamie on the front desk very helpful with local information and advised us where to get tickets for broadway at a low price.. excellent!! Lifts (elevators) was express so got you to your floor very quicky, Rooms extremly clean and quiet big for New York! Overall a great hotel, fantastic staff and amazing location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Good service, excelent service”
Reviews.Author: fsegovia
Reviews.Content: The check in was fast less five minutes, the room was clean, quiet, and comfortable, near times square, metro, bus stations, good location, but at night in the street corner there is a bar like as a dangerous site, therefore we never had security problems when we walked at night, the breakfast is good can be better, the only complaint is the soap, do not put enough soap in the bathroom, one night i had to ask for one because we didnt not have. good price

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Easy Access to the City”
Reviews.Author: AGirlInVermont
Reviews.Content: Selected this Hotel because it was near Javits Convention Center where a trade show was happening. A good start to the day with a substantial free breakfast, loved the cookies in the evening! Room was very neat and clean. Front desk was a great help when we had to extend our stay an extra day because of the weather. We did have to change rooms but the staff moved our bags while we were at the Trade Show. Front desk found a car for us to take us to the airport. Driver was great and the price was not anymore than a cab would be. Several comments about the elevators being slow - we didn't find that to be the case and were on the 25th floor. The Hotel does seem to host many student groups but they were fine - though it did make the breakfast area a bit busy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and hotel- excellent from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Loki5
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights and all were exceptional. The staff was wonderful and friendly and the morning breakfast was wonderful. The food was plentiful and hot and the kids loved the sausages. Loactionis perfect for shopping and close to 2 brothers pizza for a cheap dinner. can't go wrong- Great stay highly reccommend- A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, friendly & helpful staff, lovely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: funkygal3
Reviews.Content: Very decent hotel, located in a quiet street in Manhattan. It's not exactly in Times Square (about 3-4 blocks from the actual Times Square) but not far to walk or difficult to find. The street itself was quiet - which meant a good sleep at night, but just don't be walking around late at night on your own! (Then again, this is Manhattan!) Rooms were a very good size with a very comfortable bed, good lighting and very nice bathroom. Housekeeping kept the rooms nice and clean every night and the temperature could be adjusted easily. Free Wi-Fi in the hotel is definitely a plus plus! The front desk staff were exceptionally helpful and always tried to help, even if they were very busy. Safety deposit boxes are available for free, and the front desk staff were always helpful and pleasant when we needed to go into them more than once a day! Only downside was breakfast. The variety of food wasn't fantastic, and the hot food was not the best. The selection was the same everyday - frittata, omelette, scones, muffins, sausages, burger patties and cinnamon rolls. The continental selection was acceptable though, and I enjoyed hot chocolate and oatmeal everyday, with a couple of types of cereal, 2-3 types of oatmeal, fruit, yoghurt and bread. Overall, decent for a 3 star hotel in Manhattan. If the price is right, will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Janita60
Reviews.Content: Forget high prices in NYC. Stay at this hotel and you will have a great stay, breakfast and you will be centrally located. Staff is very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, location, and value”
Reviews.Author: weatherman1993
Reviews.Content: I originally wanted to stay in the Marriott Marquis in Times Square, but due to a last minute jump in airfare, decided for the less expensive Holiday Inn Express. The rooms were decent sized for a New York City hotel room. Everything was VERY clean and modern. The rooms featured the Holiday Inn Express bedding collection, triple sheeted, with a duvet and NOT a comforter. HDTVs are used in the rooms. We had a view of the city street below and some buildings. Very cool! The rate was incredible! I would even say DIRT CHEAP. I'd say a great value for the price. The hotel was in a great location...sort of "off the beaten path" of Times Square (less noise!) but well walkable to great dining and the theatre district. Also, it was conveniently located near the PABT transit location! I felt very safe in the area. If you're looking for a clean, convenient place to stay, you've found a great pick! Don't be expecting a mansion for a room, but expect free WiFi and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Tango-Xpress
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located by a short walk from Times Square. There is plenty of entertainment and eating places around. We got a room on the top floor (36th), which was easy to access thanks to 2 fast elevators. The 2 double bed rooms are quite small - two suitcases already take most of the floor space, and the wardrobe is pretty small too, but it is Manhattan after all. The bathroom was compact, but covered the needs, also the water pressure was good. Internet, complimentary, worked more or less without problems. Breakfast - well, as most of it is served in the almost-open-air appendix, then during the snowy period it was quite chilly there. But the servings were sufficient, of usual HIX standard. In addition, during non-breakfast hours, you can always take free tea and coffee at the drinks corner. Priority Club status was recognised and a welcome gift (a bag with bottle of water, caramel candies and a pen) was provided. For the price I paid, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HotelIndigoVH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express this past weekend. I was in town to visit friends, and wanted to stay close to Times Square. This hotel is about 5 blocks off of Times Square, which was so cool. Great location if you are going to see Spiderman on Broadway (the Foxwoods Theater is only 3 blocks, easy walking distance, and by the way, Spiderman was excellent! I highly recommend it, although kids should be older than 6 - it might be a little scary for young kids. I went by myself, but the set changes were incredible). Staff was fantastic, not one employee was rude, they were all so friendly. Breakfast was good, but make sure you get down early if you want a table. Met the General Manager, Hunter, at breakfast. He was great too - saw him help the staff for breakfast, and when I checked out a couple of hours later, he was shoveling snow outside. Showed a great level of pride in his hotel. Oh, and if you need a taxi, you do have to walk about 2 blocks away. Cars & taxis were always stuck in traffic on the one-way street where the hotel is located, so if you did happen to catch a taxi, you'd probably sit for at least 20 minutes just to get around the corner. I highly recommend this hotel based on service & location, and I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service is what makes this place a winner.”
Reviews.Author: Calnev
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel with pleasant ambience-great breakfast (although I could re-arrange a few items to make it seem more spacious)-clean, modern room (small but completely adequate)-good location other than returning late at night due street dark (but safe). But, it is Hunter, the GM that makes this place the winner it is - he is the best GM I have ever met. I say this because he makes you feel welcome like a family member. Congats to all hotel employees.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel, friendly staff, safe & clean.”
Reviews.Author: dchiltonhead
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and friends to celebrate her 30th birthday. Not too familiar with NYC, I was relatively unsure what to expect with the hotel and it's location. Building up to the trip I had several email communications with Hassan (Front Desk) & Hunter (GM) regarding room reservations, dates, and bed types. They were both extremely accomodating and punctual in their responses which made the planning a very easy process.
