With our friends flying in from England to surprise my wife I was nervous that the surprise would be ruined upon check in, however, the Front Desk girls on duty were well aware of my situation (credit to Hassan/Hunter) and were extremely discreet. Our rooms were perfect - clean, modern and comfortable. The hotel staff that we encountered were very friendly - breakfast crew, Front Desk and housekeepers. Not expecting much from the complimentary breakfast I was surprised by the choice on offer: bacon, sausage patties/links, scrambled eggs, omelets, breads, bagels, cereals, pastries and fruit. This was perfect for our group to gather in the AM and plan the days events on a full stomach. I was even more impressed with the all day fruit juice fountain machine and selection of teas/coffees that were available to guests at any time - a welcome amenity after a long day exploring the city in the cold weather. The hotel was about $35 away from LaGuardia in a cab including tolls and gratuity. The Concierge arranged our transfer back to the airport for $20 each sharing a shuttle with another couple. I would definitely recommend this to other couples as some of the cab drivers refuse to go to the airport at certain parts of the day (4pm shift change in our case). The hotel's location on 39th street was ideal. A 5-10 minute pleasant walk to Times Square attractions. Subways to all the Manhattan areas were not far (even in the cold weather) - alternatively for groups of 4 or more, cabs are a lot easier for relatively the same price as the subway. Around the hotel there were also tons of restaurants, bars, take outs especially on 8th & 9th avenue. We had a wonderful time in NYC and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn Express Times Square. Definitely would return to this hotel for future stays. Thanks again. DC

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, crowded, awful breakfast and smallest rooms in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: EnDumEn
Reviews.Content: After landing in New York City finding out that the apartment we had booked was unavailable we had to stay one night at Holiday Inn Express at 39th street. It was a stay to remember bot not to recommend. The tiny lobby was crowded with bags and people, the room was SMALL and decorated in a 1970's fashion and the breakfast was horrible. When we came down to eat nothing was left but awful white toast and watery coffee. The dining area looked like a very run down Mc Donald's. Not something you want to see on the first day of your vacation. The staff told us they were out of everything so we skipped the dry toast and had breakfast at Le Pain Quotidien instead. I have to say that the room was very clean, nothing wrong with that, but the elevator, staircase and breakfast area were in need of some refurbishing. I do not recommend this place to anyone who cares about ambiance. It might be good if you just want a bed to sleep in though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: stnkyoe
Reviews.Content: Check in was super easy. Front desk clerks were friendly & knowledgeable. Rooms were small but clean. Elevators were fast. Slept great! So close to subways & shopping. We would definitely stay here again & recommend to all. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “The Service Sucks!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1064
Reviews.Content: If you come to this hotel BEWARE of the rude, arrogant staff. The front desk personnel is very rude especially ALEX. Several occassions I had problems with my room (the toilet) and went to the front desk. (Alex asked me what did I do to the toilet. He claimed each time I reported it they came and fixed it. I am sorry but I don't destroy others property! I was in shock to be accussed.) They acted like you were bothering them when you expected them to help you. The nerve of me to ask them for help! My sister and I stayed there for 7 nights. On the 4th day, our toilet clogged up. It took me three days of complaining before the lady in charge of maintenance came to our room and told us that we should have called her department to report it. Who knew that telling the front desk was not the good option? Anyway, the night before we were to leave, she came up with the solution to leave the plunger in our room for us to use in case it clogged up again. SERIOUSLY, I AM PAYING GOOD MONEY TO HAVE TO PLUNGE MY OWN TOILET?? I would have put up a big fight except for the fact that we were checking out the next morning. THANK GOODNESS! Needless to say, it got old and smelly having to put up with a broken toilet for those last days and nights. I wrote a personal email to Mr. Hunter's email and after a week, still have not gotten any type of reply. It makes me feel as though he does not believe the horrible experience that we had. I visit NY twice a year and decided to try this hotel this time. I must say that I have never been treated this way by any other hotel in NY. If you are expecting good service from this hotel, you are warned. They do not know what good service is. They should also give their front desk staff training in customer relations as they certainly do need it!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but insufficient elevators”
Reviews.Author: ramolnar
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express isn't a bad hotel, but it's hurt by physics. It appears that the owners converted an older mid-rise, with about 35 floors. They decided to go with 6 small rooms on each floor. I'm not looking for suburban size, but these are very small. On the positive side, they are clean and properly equipped; I slept well. The biggest problem, and this is major, is that there is only space for 2 elevators, each of which struggle to fit 8 people. With luggage, that means 5 or 6. This is nowhere near enough. I was on floor 30. In the morning, about 9:50 AM, I finish packing and walk out to hit the button. 3 minutes later, a full elevator arrives. Another 3-4 minutes pass after I hit the button again, and the second elevator is full. Now worried about being late to a tour, I carry my suitcase down 30 flights. I make the tour, but my knees hurt. Remember, there are only 6 floors above me. What would someone on floor 15 do? Wait an hour? In a competitive market like New York, there are better options. You could walk around the corner to the Staybridge, for instance, which is generally cheaper, has larger rooms, and 3 larger elevators. Or you could book the Candlewood next door. The cinnamon rolls in the morning, while nice, aren't enough to recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Scubapal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are professionals who live on Long Island and work long days in Manhattan and NJ. Between the 2 of us, we stay in hotels in Manhattan 1-2x weekly. Sometimes I arrive late the night before working so I won't have to commute the next day. While HI Express at 39th St. isn't in the best area and I could pay to stay in a more upscale neighborhood -- but the staff is so accommodating and the hotel rooms so clean and comfortable I keep coming back. Evening staff --specifically, Rudy-- is professional, courteous, and makes check-in a positive experience --even if it's 1 AM. Over the years I've had negative experiences checking in after midnight . On one occasion I pre-paid for a room and despite calling to say I'd arrive at midnight -- my room was given away. I received an apology and was offered a refund that took 2 weeks to process..... but needless to say after traveling back home at 1 am and missing work the next day, I want nothing to do with that hotel chain (a big name in the industry, begins with "M"). At this HI Express --not only will they hold your room and offer the best available location but if you arrive late and are a Priority Club member, they offer late checkout. Add to that free breakfast and lovely Christmas decor in the lobby. I doubt there's a friendlier, cleaner, more comfortable hotel at this price in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle and bright lights...”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Shaws_Holidays
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 1st December for 3 nights and had a lovely stay. We werent in the hotel much as we were out and about exploring the sights! This hotel is set a little walk away from Times Square, but we walked in everyday so it was OK. Breakfast was.... questionable. It was OK but you can find nicer breakfasts out, but the buffet bfast was all complimentary so we didnt moan. Free Wifi, there are 2 computers to use in the lobby but i connected my phone to it and was great to have to keep in touch with the UK. Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. Bathroom very clean, What more could we ask for! Great Hotel and would reccoment to others.

Reviews.Title: “best value i have found in new york city”
Reviews.Author: jeff2010_10
Reviews.Content: On arrival I found that my booking had been cancelled due to my supplier (chase travel) going bankrupt. Hassan, the front office manager, took charge and sorted things very quickly,efficiently, and in a most friendly manner. The room was a little small but spotlessly clean. All the amenities were very good. Quality of food at breakfast was excellent. The only moan that I could have was that the breakfast room was extremely cold.. This however did not mar my enjoyment of our stay. Had it not been for Hassan we could have had a disastrous visit to the Big Apple. Would also mention a restaurant, Frankie and Johnnies on 8th Ave and 45th Street. STEAK TO DIE FOR.

Reviews.Title: “The staff could care less about anyone staying there, ignorant...”
Reviews.Author: Whatsthisisee
Reviews.Content: You would think by it's name it would be a good hotel, let me list the inconviences.. -When we arrived, it was 6 adults and 4 children. We ordered 3 rooms and 1 of the 3 werent ready..and it was way after check-in..so we into the 2 rooms to wait and we rtealized they gave us the wrong rooms. We went to talk to the concierge and he said when you book and they don't have the room available the give you the standard room..BUT THEY DONT TELL YOU AND YOU STILL HAVE TO PAY THE SAME PRICE. Funny part is, he knew it was not what we booked and didnt say anything at the check-in. -When we returned from our night out the room still wasn't ready, so we practically paid for a room we didnt use. -DONT VALET YOUR CAR..I WAITED 1 HOUR FOR IT!!! And when the valet guy pulled up he was doing about 65mph in my truck. Oh and parking was $55, you would think for that price it would be 1 minute. -One room had a doorbell that was broke and went off beeping all night and they never fixed it..we told them and they said "oh well" -When we tried to explain our issues to Oksana the receptionist, she had a terrible attitude and was annoyed at us because he hotel sucked!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ang687
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend and have no complaints! It was clean, fairly quiet and overall a great stay! Free wireless internet was good. The breakfast was decent and a money saver. The elevators were a bit slow at times but not terrible. Staff were friendly and helpful. Close enough to walk to most places, lots of restaurants close. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel , very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: jashwinm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a stop over in New York. Was presently surprised with the hotel, excellect service and location. Walking distance to time square and the other attractions. Very clean and nice, excellent in-room internet for free. Very good breakfast and excellent coffee : -). Will definately stay here again as it is an well priced hotel in New york

Reviews.Title: “First time in NY and stayed at the perfect economic but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lozanobunch
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, rooms were really clean, and no bed bugs! Got a room with a view so I could have that real NY feeling. If you do that, you must be okay with a lot of noise. Pizzeria across the street is really good. Had the hotel breakfast every morning and it was very good. Coffee is delish and so are the cinnamon rolls baked fresh! Perfect location. Walked to times square everyday and caught subway to all destinations. I felt safe even at night. Only two elevators so there is a wait at times. Very nice hotel for the price. It was a good first timer experience. I would go back today if I could get the room for free. For now, I will save my money for another visit next year hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very satisfied with the hotel but good luck getting a cab to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Xt82
Reviews.Content: I was slightly uneasy about selecting a hotel in NYC for a trip with two girlfriends this past weekend because of the current bed bug issue and our relative unfamiliarity with the city, but this hotel was nearly perfect for our needs. The rooms were very clean, the beds and linens were comfortable, and the location was pretty central. We actually had a phenomenal experience dealing with the staff - the front desk and cleaning staff were incredibly helpful and polite. It would have been a flawless experience had it not been for the very last part of my trip. When I was leaving the hotel to catch my flight out of LaGuardia, the bellman offered to hail me a cab. After approx 5-10 minutes it was clear he was having some difficulty getting a cab to the airport. He informed me the hotel contracted with a private car company and I could take one of their rides for $45 - a rate that included all tolls and gratuity. I was skeptical since I had heard these rides were a scam, but he assured me this company was affiliated with the hotel and trustworthy. Since $45 was around what I was expecting to pay in total for the cab and I confirmed with him THREE times that this was a flat rate, I agreed. Not five minutes into the ride was the driver attempting to get more cash out of me and saying that the $45 did not include toll fees. Unbelievable. I persisted and refused to give him any additional money but it really left a bad taste in my mouth. I would not recommend any hotel guests use this option, and I would recommend the hotel seriously consider switching the company they work with for this service or at least audit the drivers or bellman. Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a good deal, sure, otherwise don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: OCtravelgirl82
Reviews.Content: The location was not bad, but not on the side of Times Square I'd have hoped for. The room was VERY small and even though I booked well in advance I was forced to take one King bed rather than two Queens. The elevator takes DECADES in the morning. I called to prepay out hotel with my bosses CC as this was partially a business trip and when I got there they had no payment on file. It took an hour to sort out and they seemed very put out by helping me. When it was time to leave I called to get help with bags and 45 mins later, no one came. Tried to do it myself but after 20 mins of waiting for the elevator, it still hadn't come. Called again, 30 mins later, still nothing. I had to walk down 20 flights of stairs and just tell them to go get my bags. They offer an ok breakfast, the cooked food tastes nasty (not real eggs) but its so packed and in such a small space, good luck. The lobby is tiny so if there are a few people there trying to do things you are cramped. Staff will let you stand around waiting for help. No one is very polite, all seem put out to be doing their job. In this economy they should be grateful to have jobs. There was blood on my duvet, just a tiny spot like someone has a tiny cut on their finger so I didn't flip out, but kinda gross. The vending machines for ice/etc. are on random floors so you get to wait 20 mins for the elevator to get ice. No room service. There is a GREAT italian place right across the street from the front entrance. We had a block rate making this cheap otherwise I'd never have stayed here. If you get a great deal go for it, otherwise don't waste your time with the rude staff. Oh and one staff member wears so much cheap perfume you can smell before you walk in the hotel that she is there. Made me ill all weekend. No blackout shades in bedroom so hotel guests across the street could see through our sheer curtains. Odd!

Reviews.Title: “walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building, Theatres and great restaurants”
Reviews.Author: getawaygirl109
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights at this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Our room was on the fifth floor (506?) and faced the street so we did hear the odd early morning delivery but air con worked well so didn't need to have the windows open. Our room had plenty of room for our luggage and us. We had a king sized bed, two night tables, desk and armoire. The bathroom was definitely adequate with a tub/shower combination. I chose this hotel because of the 'included breakfast'. I had read of other travellers taking along zip lock bags to take snacks from breakfast to snack on during the day and while I forgot my ziplock baggies I did take bananas, oranges and yogurt back to our room to enjoy as a mid morning snack while we were out exploring New York. The breakfast buffet was super and included; fresh fruit, bananas, oranges, apples and fruit salad. A juice bar with orange, apple and lemonade. Instant oatmeal, dry cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, cinnamon buns, sausages (links and patties), pre-made omelets, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, small cartons of milk, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. A sign in our washroom stated "complimentary toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, shaving cream or razor, if forgotten" you just had to call the front desk. We took a cab from LaGuardia airport to our hotel (cost $28 US before tip). We walked to the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Madison Square Garden, Macy's and had an easy walk to Central Park and to Penn Station where you could take the subway everywhere. We took it to the South Ferry Station to catch the ferry to Ellis Island. The Hop On/Hop Off bus is a must but ride the full circuit first and then hop on or off.

Reviews.Title: “3 blocks from Times Square”
Reviews.Author: ever1lily
Reviews.Content: The HI Express worked out great for us. Very close to TS, which is what we wanted, great value, and no bedbugs!! The room was small, but for the limited amount of time we spent in the room, it was do-able. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We missed out on breakfast on Sunday due to the large turnout - not enough seating for everyone. We made breakfast on Monday and were pleasantly surprised by the selection. They really provided a nice variety of foods! The service staff was very pleasant. The only problem, which we read about in advance, were the elevators. Only 2 and with the large amount of visitirs there, it was very slow at times. Made the walk down the stairs from the 26th floor once, the other times had to wait 5+ minutes at times. Overall, a great experience, would not hesitate to book another stay with HI, and would recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Triley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really close to all attactions. It might be a little pricey but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Way To Stay”
Reviews.Author: ed_selby
Reviews.Content: I had to come to NYC for a business conference and needed to be near Times Square, but my boss said it had to be less than $X per night. It was a challenge, but the HIE fit the bill perfectly. The price was right (even low for the area). The room was small, but comfortable with a nice view of the southern end of the city. It was within easy walking distance to Times Square. My wife went with me, and she was thrilled that the hotel was right in the garment district! The included breakfast made my company controller happy - no NYC priced breakfasts on my expense report! I became a fan of HIE when the brand first came into existence, and hotels like this one do a great job of solidifying the reputation of clean, safe, convenient locations. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: chris_of_oz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Husband and five year old while on a three night breeze-through NYC in April 2010. We were charged US $ 360 for a room we could barely turn around in and the staff were exceptionally unhelpful... bordering on rude. After the first night my husband walked in to the hotel right next door - Candlewick Suites - and managed to get us a room there for the next two nights which was much larger and had a little fully equipped kitchenette as well - for a good $120 US less - PER NIGHT. Would not reccommend the Holiday Inn Express TimeSquare NYC to my worst enemies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, internet and even breakfeast”
Reviews.Author: gordytravel
Reviews.Content: Our cruise was leaving from NYC and we wanted to stay in NYC for an extra day leaving on the cruise and returning from the cruise. We started searching for a inexpensive hotel an Holiday Inn Express popped up. We took a look around the area using Google and we were glad we stayed in this hotel. Penn Station, Times Square, Empire State, 5th Avenue, Broadway all within walking distance and for a price that did not break the bank. If you are looking for a basic place place to sleep and would like a central location, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: NorthOnt
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, located within 5 minutes walking distance to many popular NY city destinations including Times Square, Broadway, Empire State, Madison Square Gardens, 5th Ave/Madison Ave. shopping and more. The subway is also within 5 minutes walking distance. The hotel was very clean, quiet, well-equipped and nicely furnished/decorated. The staff were very polite, knowledgable and helpful. We stayed in the King Size Room with City View and had a great view of the river and the Empire State Building. The room was a good size and had enough storage for our 6 night/7 day trip to NYC. The bathroom was stocked with good quality toiletries and all other standard amenities were provided (in-room coffee maker, hairdryer, iron/ironing board). Nice flat screen tv's, comfortable bed, black-out curtains. The continental breakfast is the best we ever had at any other hotel. There was a variety of fresh fruit, a variety of grains (breads/cereals/oatmeal), eggs, sausage, variety of dairy products, etc. Very good! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It definitely made our stay in New York a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive for the price!”
Reviews.Author: crista009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn for only one night but we were there for 2 full days. Staff was friendly and efficient. They held our bags at 8 am until we came back later and checked in around 3 pm. The room & bathroom were very clean and actually matched the pictures shown. Beds & 4 pillows per bed were comfy. The room had all the basic amenities (iron/board, hairdryer, coffee & maker, toiletries) and the elevators were pretty quick. We didn't use the wi-fi, but they offered it for no charge throughout the hotel & in the room! They also have two computers & 1 printer in the lobby that we did use to check into our flight & print our boarding passes. The FREE continental breakfast was actually more than just a danish. They had bagels, yougurt, eggs, biscuts, fruit, yougurt & more. An outdoor enclosed patio was opened that morning to accomodate the breakfast goers with tables and chairs, nice. We check out early the next day and they held our bags again. I truly enjoed my stay there. I paid half the price that I did last year for another hotel and it was in bad condition. This one seems like its taylored for the business traveler, but it worked for us since we just needed a place for a night. Closer to Port Authority Bus Terminal than to Times Square, but not too far from the subway (couple of blocks). Although it looked full, we didn't hear anything from the rooms next to us. I would visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Switched hotels after the first night”
Reviews.Author: daniella95
Reviews.Content: When they say it's located IN times square, this is a LIE. It is a few blocks from "the" times square and is extremely small. The front desk is rude, we called for a travel kit (as the sign in the bathroom said if we needed it to call) and they did not give it to us. We waited about 45 minutes after calling about 6 times and still didn't receive it. The "lobby" is literally the size of my bedroom and the rooms aren't any better. They are very very small, can barely fit your luggage. We ended up taking the stairs most times cause the elevator was always full or taking way too long. After the first night we immediately changed to the Renaissance actually located IN times square, and had a VERY enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: 18thStreet
Reviews.Content: Competent staff, very clean rooms, comfortable bed, reasonably priced and good, complimentary breakfast selection. Property is convenient to Times Square, subway and the "Hell's Kitchen Market," weekends, is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Fun26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, only a few blocks from Time Square. It was very convenient. Going to Times Square and able to go back to the Hotel and drop of things or rest was very helpful. The hotel is surrounded by high end restaurants and some hidden local restaurants that serve delicious food. Wonderful Hot Breakfast and service. Service provided by the staff was great as well. The only downfall was the elevators. The elevators were slow at times.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: HB21212121
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this hotel and overall was a very good experience. Impressed with the cleanliness, the breakfast was better than expected - good choices for a healthy breakfast. Close to Times Square, a bit of a walk. Helpful front desk staff. We experienced no waits or problems with the elevators and we were on the 35th floor. The positives far outweighed the negatives for us. The ice machines were only on certain floors, ours being one so it was noisy in the middle of the night when people came to get ice at 3 in the morning. Rooms were a bit small but if you're just sleeping there, which we were, it was good. Air conditioner worked extremely well, the amenities in the bathroom were fine. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I just stayed there for the location.”
Reviews.Author: Hadeel-AM
Reviews.Content: Well... I liked the location, the hotel was walking distance from Times Square, Macy's, and most places around there. It was a 5 minute walk to most places. The rooms were small but did not care about that because I was out most of the time. Overall if your are in the city for shopping and sightseeing this hotel is fine given the location and value of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to like, a little to put up with”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: Here's what I like about the Holiday Inn Express Times Square. It's clean and modern. Plenty of heavy-duty towels. A huge flat screen TV and real HD channels. Big, comfortable beds. A generous supply of electric outlets. Quiet rooms, only 6 to a floor. Best of all, my two favorite amenities: a free, well stocked breakfast, and free high speed wifi. Here's what is less than perfect: small rooms, hardly any shelf space in the bathroom, and it's not really at Times Square but a half mile walk past the bus terminal and down a rather grungy street. But I'd walk that walk any day for the user-friendly amenities at this hotel. I notice comments about the elevators. I stayed on the 34th floor and never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The building is interesting - apparently it contains 3 tall and thin hotels side by side, which is why there are only 6 rooms to a floor, and why - at least for my stay - 2 elevators can do the job in a 36 floor hotel. As for value, I had a great rate from a discount website, and if the Holiday Inn's rack rates were twice that price, it would get 5 stars for value. Unfortunately, they are considerably more. At $300+ per night, the small rooms and somewhat gritty neighborhood would be harder to overlook, but for a reasonable discount the HI-Express is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “OK in NY”
Reviews.Author: TheEnglishTourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights at the end of June. As this was our second trip to NY we knew that the rooms would be small by normal American standards and this hotel was no exception. But as we were only sleeping there did that really matter? The hotel provided the standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast, juice cereal and do-it-yourself toast and coffee which was OK as a start to the day. The location on the west side was in a bit of a run down area, but we didn't feel unsafe going too and from the hotel at all times of day. Although called Times Square it's really about 15 minutes walk away. The only down side for us was that having pre-booked on the basis of a certain price for the stay, when we came to pay on the day we seemed to get hit for Tourist Tax, above that which we were quoted on the Web site. Buyer Beware..!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite live up to the brand”
Reviews.Author: A2Mich_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The pros: location, breakfast and price (i.e., good value). Cons: service. I had hoped to write a favorable review; my expectations were to have an experience consistent with other HI Express stays, recognizing rooms are very small in New York City. Unfortunately there were just too many mix ups to endorse this hotel. First, we were given keys to a room that was already occupied, the second day the cleaning crew arrived at our room after 4:30-just as we arrived to freshen up for dinner-so our room was never cleaned, the last straw was when our invoice arrived and showed that we had been charged $20 per night more than our contracted rate (which was happily fixed without incident). The location is convenient to the subway lines and Times Square, and there are several hotels in the immediate vicinity, which I would be inclined to check out on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “If rooms were any smaller you would be out the window before your suitcase was in the door.”
Reviews.Author: sulo7
Reviews.Content: Small doesn't even come close to a description of the rooms in this hotel. Asked to change to room with two beds and were told not possible. Over priced and management was not concerned about our over crowded conditions. Their solution and ours was move to a different hotel . Location though close enough to Times Square is not in an ideal neighborhood. We were glad to move after one night. Rooms were however clean and quiet. Ok for

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: scmommy8
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I went to NYC to celebrate her 60th birthday at the end of July. Having been to NYC before and wanting to stay somewhere close to the theater district, we chose this hotel b/c we could use our Visa rewards points on a room. Overall, we had a very good stay. The hotel is very new and clean. The beds are comfortable, it seemed to be very quiet, and the complimentary breakfast was wonderful (and a cost saver in NY). There was also free wireless internet which was nice. For us, the location worked, however, we also like to walk a lot - I could see where some others may not like the location. It is very close to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, and the bus depot. There are also plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. However, it is a little misleading to call it the Holiday Inn Express "Times Square" as it is not in Times Square but actually quite a few blocks over. (We actually ended up being thankful for this though b/c I think that is why it was quiet there.) That being said, you can walk to Times Square and the theater district in about 10 minutes, or to Central Park in about 20/30 minutes. So it really depends on how much you want to walk (or take public transportation). Other than that, my only complaints would be small ones - the room was smaller (but that is kind of expected in NYC), and it was hard to regulate the temperature both on the thermostat and in the shower. The hotel itself was pretty small - only about six rooms on each floor - but very tall (about 40 floors). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and if you are like us and walk a lot, then the location shouldn't be a problem. We decided after this trip that next time we would probably stay in another neighborhood, but that is just our preference.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in the Center of NYC :-)”
Reviews.Author: LoveLiveDivaLife
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for weekend and was very pleased with the rooms and the hotel staff. The reviews are pretty accurate in that the hotel is small (which I did not mind because I was never there for an extended period of time) and the elevators are slow because there are only two that service the entire hotel including the staff. I found that the elevators were hard to get during peak times, especially during the complimentary breakfast. However, you cannot beat the location! Its great to be four blocks away from Times Square and the Metro. Also, I had a nice view of the city from my room. I was happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “value for money stay”
Reviews.Author: haroonb
Reviews.Content: My third stay in new york and this hotel was the best as far as value was concerned. Rooms are small but as expected. Given early check in at 11am. Front desk staff were excellent and heeded to my request for a third floor room. Breakfast was enjoyable and we were always there at 7:30am when it was always quite. Good location with easy walk to all attractions. For USD200.00 per night for a family of 4 including brealfast exceeded my expectations for a New York Hotel!! Remember you just need to plan to beat the crowds at breakfast and request a lower floor room..Therefore book early and youll also get the best rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: erik337
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location for the price. 2 blocks from a subway. Walking distance to times square. Rooms are clean and bed is comfortable. I don't know when, but the property seems to have been renovated recently. The immediate area is average ... not trendy, but not a slum. Felt safe walking to/from hotel at night. Small rooms, but that's what you expect in NYC. Free breakfast included cereal, juice, yogurt, scrambled eggs w/ cheese, biscuits, gravy, sausage, toast, bagels, coffee, fruit. Get down early though, because later it's a zoo. Staff was friendly and helpful. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is New York, New York”
Reviews.Author: broke05
Reviews.Content: I am quite a global traveller though I mostly spend my leisure and vacation time in places all over Japan, Thai, Toronto, the UK . New York is a city re-visited after 32 years. I read the latest 10 reviews before I write so as to keep a more impartial view on my experiences and those vacationers'. The hotel should acknowledge that the front staff fail to give a consistent and regular hospitality service to all at different time and days. I had both carrot and stick in my four night stays. While Roger impresses me with his prompt and casual and easy going manner, some are still keeping a busy, don't-care-less attitude. The A/C system is the best of all amenities. The lighting cannot provide good night reading condition though I admit that westerners would prefer romance to practicality. Toiletry is sufficient for daily use save the absence of glass for rinsing. Those plastic cups are too small. We cannot complain too much about the elevators. This building may not be for hotel accommodation in its primary construction, and nothing the hotel can do to speed up lifting. Without space for another service lift, both staff and guests should pardon each other for inconvenience and mess. If not, the best solution is to demolish it. By the way, this is HI Express. I know what I would get, and I would where the location should be by the name. In my home city, the HI Express is housed in a brand new building for 2-3 star accommodation for back-packers, tours, family holiday-makers and solo visitor like me, adjacent to Times Square, a shopping magnet for all tourists and the local. But this is New York. I believe I get the best value with what I pay though I do have complaints. The continental breakfast is not 'continental'. It is quite 'New York', providing choices of food and varities close to a full breakfast. And it is complimentary! Try those continental breakfasts in Europe and the UK, and you understand why I am so grateful to what I can eat for my breakfast. The hotel even provides instant oatmeal in addition to cornflakes of three kinds and chilled yogurt. So, give concession to crowdiness. Provide spacing for each other. Be less selfish and less dominant. I saw a lady not giving way to a long queue unless she finished toasting ten slices of bread and two English muffins using the one-and-only-one toaster for 4 slices at a time. (why only one? I scratch my head to work out a reason) Yes, about something missing: I also lost my sachet of bath treatment the next day. The maid might have considered this a trash, but the sachet is unopen in its original packaging, and it should not be mistaken as an abandoned object. I wrote a very polite memo to advise the maid to return it to me, in case they found it somewhere. The note was on the table unattended. English? They may understand English, but can they communicate with guests well? I spent usually one hour in the quiet late morning to check and send e-mail, in the 'business centre' next to the staff laundry room, and I had not heard a word in English every time I was there. All staff there speak their own native language in a joyful, reckless and care-free manner which I hope I can have a share. I understand that the basement is their territory, but it is a space in New York, and their working time should not be taken for granted as their own free time. Besides, it is courtesy to speak a language that people around can understand in hospitality industry, Jay, you are the only manager who replies to reviews in this column. Salute you! joechan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base while on vacation”
Reviews.Author: disneykristen
Reviews.Content: I made myself a promise that I would write this review before I go home because I know if I go home it will get lost in a stack of things to do and that wouldn't be fare. Having worked in major hotels with Disney, Hilton and Holiday Inn I can be a picky travel guest. This hotel beyond exceeded my expectations. In fact I cancelled another reservation and stayed longer at this location. It is right in the middle of everything and very clean for a city hotel. Yes the elevators are slow but your in cool AC while waiting. The breakfast is crowded but its free in NYC. I honestly couldnt have asked for a better holiday and I havent seen staff like this in a long time. They smile and are informative and if they dont know they find out which is incredible. Hunter was awesome too! He helped me move my reservation when I got sick and then helped when I wanted to stay longer. KEEP DOING WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not care about you!”
Reviews.Author: SAMPLESIZE
Reviews.Content: We made these reservations over the internet and prepaid them. Upon arrival, we were treated like unwelcomed relatives. We stayed 2 nights and the second day our room was never cleaned or resfreshed. Believe the other reviews about the elevators. You need HUGE patience. The thermostats have govenors on them. You can not get any cooler than 68 degrees and it was 102 outside! The ice machines don't work and most of the staff don't speak english. LOL to you if you are brave enough to stay here. NEVER again!

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: kimrey86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 4th of July. I really have no complaints. We stopped in around noon to see if we could check in before 3:00 and they let us check in right then, which was very convenient. The room was small, but that didn't matter and we expected it. Bed was comfy, room was clean, no noise issues and we had a very nice view on the 21st floor. After reading the reviews I expected the elevator situation to be a nightmare and it wasn't. In my experience what made the elevator go slow was people who were on the second, third, fourth floors using it. I understand if you have a lot of luggage, but if you don't just use the stairs. We were on the 21st floor and we used the stairs when we didn't feel like waiting...and even when we did decide to wait, it wasn't long at all. Anyway, we would definitely stay here again and I recommend it to anyone who needs a not-so-expensive, decent place to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: estherbeme
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I start. Maybe the guy standing outside the front of the hotel urinating against the wall when we arrived. There is a very popular gay night club on the corner and it get very crowded with the outside lines. Saw a few alteration and fights on the nights I was returning to our room. It is a few blocks from Times Square so it is very convenient. Rooms are very small but the staff was helpful when the shower plugged up, air condition started smelling like it was burning. Elevator waits were long. Lobby was packed with luggage everywhere and no where to sit down in the lobby other than the four seats which were always taken. This was my 5th trip to NY and I have stayed in much nicer but costly hotels. So I guess the moral of the story really is ..you do get what you pay for especially in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Safety, Comfort & Location Outstanding. Overall Very Good Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Fourseasondreamer
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend trip to NYC. I was alone so my safety along with location were of extreme importance. I found the hotel quite acceptable. I arrrived early and my room was not ready as they were sold out the night before. They offered to strore my bag and I was on my way! I returned exhausted around 5:00 and the room was ready. My room was 2904. It was spotless, quiet, offered a view and very inviting after a day walking the streets of NYC. The bed was very comfortable. The shower pressure was good too. The area of imporvement would be with the elevators. There are only two and they seem slow. There were 15-20 people, all with luggage trying to get to their rooms. I waited around 10 minutes. I should mention that was only during the busy time. Later that evening and the following morning I didn't have any trouble whatsoever. TIPS ABOUT NYC: I took the Super Shuttle from JFK in to the city. NEVER again! From the time that I landed until I reached the door of the hotel...4 hours! A taxi with the $45.00 flat fee is the way to go if time is valuable to you while in NYC. I had great difficulty getting a cab back to the room and to JFK. Literally 5 cabs wouldn't take me back to the room (not because I'm sketchy or smell bad either! :-)). They wouldn't take me because the fare would have been to low. However at midnight after a day of walking and being alone I wanted to take a cab, COULDN'T get one off the street. I did go the the Marriot Marquis in Times Square where they have a cab line. It was only then that I was able to get back. The subway is the way to travel, in my opinion, while in NYC. It was FULL of tourists and some locals and was VERY safe. I got to WTC in 10 minutes, back to shopping on Canal St in 3, back to Times Square in 4. All for $2.75. If you are going to WTC there are two different commemorative sites. One a museum and the other a small gift shop type place. St. Pauls Church accross the street is chock full of history (George Washingtons Pew for example) and also has a lot of 9-11 rememberances. Within Times Square is an old converted theater dedicated to Times Square called the "Times Square Guild? Consortium?" They were very informative and offer Broadway shows at face value. TKTS TKTS booth does not sell tickets to Jersey Boys. It sells out every night. INCREDIBLE show. A must see and not a bad seat in the place. KIng Tuts exhibition is well worth the $29.00 to get in if you like to see genuine antiquities. Really outstanding. Good Luck and Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect of Holiday Inn quality”
Reviews.Author: Prakash_D
Reviews.Content: Experience : stay was just ok. Did not provide the comfort and good feeling a business traveller seeks. The room is small, lack of fresh air / ventilation. The lift waiting time is huge - i stayed on 31st floor and took considerable time to go up/down. Surprised that 2 lifts are believed to suffice the volume of traffic in normal times. Breakfast was of low quality. The orange juice was not availble on many days; the options of items are limited by any standard; and you are expected to eat in themocol plates with plastic cutlery ! a big turnoff. Never have i eaten this way in any hotel i have traveled to around the world. Staff was ok including the manager - but not hospitable or friendly enough to resolve the missing document issue at the time of check out. Wouldn't stay again there.

Reviews.Title: “My opinion as a Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelagent
Reviews.Content: The only reason I ever write Trip Advisor is if a Hotel is extremely over the top or in need of much improvement. This hotel was perfect for our get-away weekend to NYC. I took a small group last weekend and was very pleased with Holiday Inn Express. Everyone was very nice and helpful. The location is 3 blocks from Time Square, close to Broadway shows and garment district (shopping). Our rooms were very clean. Free breakfast consisted of biscuits, sausage, eggs, fruit, famous cinnamon rolls, etc. I will be making more reservations here for my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, broken elevator”
Reviews.Author: mjspes
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel as average because it was clean, the bed was very comfortable and our room was quiet. The hotel has over 30 floors with just two elevators and one was broken during our visit. We used the stairs to go down from the 17th floor to avoid the long wait. There were some irritated guests, and I see that I am not the first reviewer to have experienced this problem. The lobby is small and feels crowded. The bedroom and bathroom were also very small. It was okay, but not sure I would stay there again and risk another broken elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: geandrus
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for three nights last week for my son's graduation. The hotel was very clean. The staff were very nice and helpful. And the hotel is in a great location. We had a decent sized room with two large double beds. Bathroom was fine. Complimentary breakfast was wonderful. Staff did a good job keeping the breakfast supplies stocked with hot eggs, breakfast patties, cinnamon rolls and lots of fresh coffee. The room rates were very reasonable. Overall, I was very pleased. My family members were pleased and I highly recommend this Holiday Inn Express when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for short break”
Reviews.Author: chriskis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of April and enjoyed unseasonably warm weather around 86F!! Staff on check in were very pleasant and helpful. Had requested a room on high floor with a view and that is exactly what we got. Room on 34th Floor with views of the Empire State Building one way and the Hudson River the other. The rooms are not large but perfectly fine for a short stay. King size bed was so comfortable and had both soft and firm pillows. Well equipped with wardrobe and plenty of drawer space and 32 inch flat screen tv on wall. It also had air conditioning that you could control yourself. Coffee maker and coffee/tea/sugar/milk also supplied. Room was very clean. Bathroom was small but had a bathtub with shower over and some supplied toiletries. Very nice large fluffy white towels. Price included breakfast which consisted of juice, cereals, yogurts, pastries, bagels, toast etc. Also on some days boiled/scrambled eggs or omelets and beefburgers, as much tea/coffee as you like, which we found perfectly acceptable. It is only a small breakfast room and it does get crowded, but we were down by 8.30 each day and never had a problem. I have read reports on Trip Advisor of long waits for the lift and yes, there are only two lifts and there are only 6 rooms per floor and 36 floors. Whether we just lucky, I don't know, but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for the lift at any time. Downstairs in reception there is a small lounge area and complimentry tea and coffee are available 24hours a day. Also in the afternoon/early evening there was a large bowl of lovely apples on the reception desk for you to help yourself. There is a luggage storage area which is handy if you have a later flight out. There are two computers to use at no charge, and a printer. Ideal for printing out boarding passes. The street that the hotel is in is a bit dark and dreary and there is s certain amount of construction work going on, but felt quite safe there even at night. You can be on 8th Avenue in less than a minute and about 5 minutes walk to Times Square area. Staff were always ready to help and answer questions for you. This was our 5th time in NYC and we have stayed in a different hotel every time, but would certainly return her again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, helpful staff, central location”
Reviews.Author: langtounhobbit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family for a couple of nights in April 2010 after becoming stranded in New York due to the disruption caused by the volcanic eruptions in Iceland. Clean, well-presented hotel with helpful staff. We had a decent sized room with two large double beds. Bathroom was fine. Complimentary breakfast was reasonable, albeit a bit of a busy scramble - possibly because the hotel was so busy with stranded travellers running short on money !! Staff did a good job trying to keep the breakfast supplies topped up in the circumstances. Central location within easy walking distance of all midtown sites eg Empire State, Rockerfeller Centre, Times Square, Macy's etc Seemed to offer reasonable room rates (outwith the unexpected peak in demand that we experienced). Overall I would happily recommend this as a good basic hotel for a short break in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aimzabeth
Reviews.Content: This recently revamped Holiday Inn Express is in a great location, and very quiet. One odd downside-there was no toilet seat cover, nor a hook on the back of the bathroom door. One had to get pretty creative to change in the bathroom! Not an issue if you're travelling alone. The street can get a little sketchy at night, so I would not recommend a late night stroll alone. Nice free continental breakfast and a charming staff. No restaurant in the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Les_Gibs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely a good deal : very clean and quiet room, excellent location, quick check in and check out, ok breakfast (bread, cereals, omelettes, scones, muffins, ...). The only thing is that I would recommand it for early birds as it becomes crowded after 8 am : breakfast room is really tiny, and there are only two elevators for the 36 floors. We had our breakfast at 6:30, and left around 8, to make the most of our trip, and with this timing, the hotel was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: virgo0905
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in March. There were four of us in one tiny room with two double beds. There is only one night table between the two beds, one dresser and a tiny wardrobe with six hangers. This is definitely the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, however I understand this is typical of New York in general. Other than the size, there wasn't much to complain about. Yes, there are only two elevators, but we never once waited more than five minutes for one. The room was clean and supplies were restocked each morning. The wi-fi was readily available and we always had a good connection. The breakfast area is very busy in the morning so be prepared for that if you stay there. The food is so-so...eggs with a processed cheese filling, greasy sausage, and once there was bacon. There's also cereal, yogurt and bread for toast. The street outside the hotel is sketchy after dark and I wouldn't have been comfortable walking alone at night. During the day felt fine. I'd stick with walking up 8th to Times Square at night. All in all, the hotel was a clean, affordable place to lay our heads at night-nothing fancy, but just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very small”
Reviews.Author: yamily83
Reviews.Content: small rooms small lobby small breakfast area... everything is so tiny.. and the street is kind of dirty not nice street sorrounded by clothing manufacturers... the elevators is bussy bussy in the morning but you can always use the stairs going down... Quiet area... but kind of dark at night... luckly there was always a computer free but the bussines center has only two... breakfast was good.... good value per money if you plan your trip with time... There was wireless but never had good signal in my room at 156th floor and cady machines didn't work...

Reviews.Title: “Fun With The Hilliards and Jasper”
Reviews.Author: SILENT4SSASSN
Reviews.Content: It was fun, good food, clean room, good view of the city, and nice employies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTigger
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York City and we loved it. It is important to have a solid base to stay in and plan your activities. This Holiday Inn Express was fantastic. Excelent value for money with friendly staff. All we ask for when travelling away from home is a nice clean, comfortable room that we can relax in, efficient bathroom with hot water, a comfortable bed to sleep in and a light breakfast to start the day off with. This hotel was all of this and more. It's in agreat location about a five minute walk from Time Square. We will go back to New York City, so much to see and do and we will stay at Holiday Inn Express again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money Hotel, would definitely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: steph87London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of March, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting New York. It is set back from Times Square on West 39th Street but only a 5 minute walk to the main part. The rooms were great, our Travel Agent phoned ahead and arranged two double beds which were arranged for us, we stayed on the 30th floor, I'd recommend the higher the better as you can see the Empire State Building. There are only 2 lifts but we never had a problem waiting for them to arrive, they are busier in the morning when everyone is going out but that's normal for a hotel like this. The room was very nice and clean, obviously all very new, bathroom lovely too, it was also surprisingly quiet considering the location and we slept very well. Each day our room was cleaned to a great standard and towels replaced. The free breakfast each morning is also good, not a major selection but enough for the price paid for the stay. Overall I would definitely stay here again, it is a lovely hotel and all the staff were very friendly, the other reviews on here complaining about various things obviously expect a 5 star hotel when you only pay for a 3. The only thing I'd say is that 39th Street where the hotel is located is very quiet at night but we didn't feel unsafe, there is a lot of work going on around so it looks like the area will become busier.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-situated and a bit small”
Reviews.Author: ianbob
Reviews.Content: Our room was small by American standards, but comparable to that which many Europeans are accustomed. The hotel is new, likely built within the last two years. Everything was clean and well-kept. We had four people in a two-double room. It was a tight squeeze, but the value and quality of the hotel made up for the size. Like most Holiday Inns, this one included a decent continental breakfast. It included typical breakfast fare, plus some good sausage and egg breakfast sandwiches. We definitely saved some cash eating breakfast at the hotel, given how expensive Times Square restaurants are. We ran into a problem with the concierge when trying to reserve a shuttle to La Guardia. The concierge failed to give us the necessary voucher for the shuttle, so we ended up paying twice. However, the hotel staff was extremely apologetic and quickly refunded us our money as soon as we returned home. They really went above and beyond in the aftermath, calling us several times to double-check that we received our refund. I would certainly recommend the Holiday Inn Times Square South to anyone looking for a comfortable, relatively affordable, clean hotel within easy walking distance to Times Square and the subway.

Reviews.Title: “great service, perfect location overall a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zduk
Reviews.Content: i was a little anxious about staying at this hotel as i had read some of the reviews regarding the location and the small rooms, however, i was pleasantly surprised when we arrived to a clean and efficient front desk, with friendly helpful staff, and a location that made it easy to access all the major sights and transport links. rooms were clean and had everything that needed for city break, and actually were a good size for a city hotel. good breakfast although little crowded. overall great hotel friendly and amenable staff, would return.

Reviews.Title: “check around and you will find better hotels with food service”
Reviews.Author: optomist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility in late November and were disappointed. I expected better quality given the charged rate and the new status of the hotel. Limited food outlets in the neighborhood other than fast food establishments. We have located the Omni Hotel in a more central location, with full facilities, and a daily rate 65% of that charged by this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you don't mind waiting for everything”
Reviews.Author: bearmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the week after Christmas. The rates were good. However, the rooms were very small. In addition, for a hotel with 36 floors, it only has 2 elevators. It sometimes took up to 10 minutes to reach the top floor (our floor). Often, the elevator was already full because people from the lower floors had to get on and ride up because otherwise the elevator was full. Also, every morning breakfast was free. However, the line typically stretched into the lobby which meant another wait of 10 minutes or so. Finally, the business center has only 2 computers. Typically, if you were able to get the computers at all you had to wait about 20 minutes to have one open up. Another problem, whether this was just our floor or if wide spread, i'm not sure but housekeeping did not give us toilet paper. We finally had to contact the front desk to get some, which took 2 calls and over an hour wait. The key word for this hotel is WAIT for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PR_Blusea
Reviews.Content: CanÂ´t beat this location for a wonderful price. Close to all but still not noisy. We were 4 in a double room and it wasnâ€™t tiny like other NY hotels.Beds are really comfy! Nice city view from my room including Empire St Bldg. Breakfast bar was very good too. We stayed for Thanksgiving, a crowed week and we didnâ€™t have any problem. IÂ´ll definitely stay here again. Good also for families. Iâ€™m happy I discovered this hotel. Staff was very helpful with addresses, calling a car for me, they kept all my shopping bags during my Black Friday shopping experience until finished! 100% Satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheresaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay in NYC from December 4 - 8th, 2009 and what a great place to stay at. The staff was wonderful, everyone from the front desk staff to housekeeping - they were all so courteous, polite and very accomodating. The Continental Breakfast was excellent! There was always enough food for everyone - never a shortage! The rooms were small but very clean! Location was great - just 3 blocks to Time Square. Also within walking distance to Broadway and 5th Avenue. 39th Street is not the greatest to walk down in the night as all the businesses close around 6:00 pm so it feels a little unsafe. You just have to take 8th Avenue to 42nd and you are fine. There is always a lot of traffic and people walking there! When leaving we were met by the bell man and asked if we needed a shuttle ride to the airport. Price was great and our driver was very professional, courteous and very friendly - got us to the airport quickly and safely. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to NYC for a great great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: useless_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very welcoming and warm. Service from ALL members of staff was excellent. The room was small, but perfectly formed, had every thing we needed. it was only a short walk away from times square its self. we found a couple of really good restaurants a few streets away, which the reception staff helped us with. The best thing i can say is! 'stay there' its great. they even look after your luggage for you, after you've checked out. I'd definitely recommend this hotel. Oh and you get a really nice breakfast thrown in with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant central HI Express Times Square South”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nites this past weekend. The hotel is squeezed in between 2 other affialiated hotels, a candlewood suites and a hampton inn. Location is on 39th street,about 150 feet from the corner of 9th ave-- 4 block walk to times square. 9th is better to walk at night to TS as 39th street is mostly businesses closed by 6pm and deserted. Rooms are compact on the order of a Eureopean hotel room, with about two feet of space on the side of the K bed near the window. Breakfeast and free internet are available, making for a nice savings on the rate. Rooms are quiet-we were on the 32nd fl and heard no street noise nor from adjacent rooms-4 rooms to a floor, 36 floors. Hotel is less than 1 year old so rooms are fresh and comfortable. One of the elevators seemed to be fast and the other slow. Staff is friendly and hotel concierge is helpful. Nearest subway is 8th/42. Good restaurant choices in Hells Kitchen area/restaurant row-try our favorite, Hell's Kitchen for upscale mexican and Basiliica across the street for the prixe fixe pre-theatre special. For theatre tickets, 50% off tyr the Visitor's Ino Cetner at 7th/53. All other things being equal , because of the location, I would stay at the Marriott Courtyard Times Sq on 40th/7th as that hotel is better situated toTS and more amenities. See prior review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: vikramjain79
Reviews.Content: In the heart of midtown Manhattan, this is a great hotel to stay in. It has recently been renovated so the rooms are brand new. It's a few minutes' walk to the Times Square. Tip: Have your breakfast as soon as you can because it is only available till stocks last!

Reviews.Title: “good place, bad service/management”
Reviews.Author: MILANI83
Reviews.Content: not far away from the times square, good hotel overall. one incident where i forgot 240 $ in the drawer and the housekeeper took it away! i informed the hotel manager who knew the lady but didnt do anything. wounderful conceirge, front desk

Reviews.Title: “The Holiday Inn Express is a very new hotel hotel, close to Madison Square Gardens.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky38
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express is a very new hotel hotel, close to Madison Square Gardens. I booked the hotel through Priceline $100 per room per night. The room allocated to me was on the first floor, when asked if I could change it, the gentleman at reception allocated a room on the 35th floor with the most amazing view at no extra cost. The bathroom has standard toiletries - shampoo/shower gel/shower cap. Hairdrier also supplied. The room has a kettle/cups, and just outside the door is an ice machine, and a snack/confectionery dispensing machine. The rooms aren't a great size, but has enough space to get ready. There is an ironing board and iron in one of the wardrobes. There is no fridge. Cleanliness - being a new hotel, it is very clean. Breakfast - good selection, suitable for vegetarians, you can also take breakfast up to your room. Would recommend taking extra teabags/milk, as they are not supplied in the room. Noise - very quiet Staff - very friendly and very accommodating. Opposite the concierge desks are two computers for free intenet use, and printers attached. Location - Very good, Penn Station is nearby, but I walked everywhere, it was about half an hour walk to Central Park, Macey's, Empire State building are very close. The street is dark, and not very well lit. Would defnitely recommend the hotel, which is aiming to become a three star hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabriella94
Reviews.Content: hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful!! Rooms were very clean and beds were comfy!!! Views from the room were just okay!! ( I expected alittle better view) overall the hotel was worth the stay and I would recommend it to friends and family!!Very short walk from penn station and subways!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sealonsf
Reviews.Content: This was the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC. I guess because it's new - we stayed in rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors and never heard traffic or other room noises. The rooms are very small as you'd expect. The beds are comfortable as others have said. The elevators are painfully slow to use so we were glad to be on lower floors so we could take the stairs. We didn't eat the breakfast - with Hot & Crusty Cafe bagels nearby we gave the typical Holiday Inn Express breakfast a miss. The front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. I wish we'd gotten this on Priceline, but the rate wasn't horrible for NYC considering there were 4 adults in the room. The biggest "minus" for me was the size of the bathroom - very small and very few "surfaces" to place towels, items on, more of a problem because there were 4 of us. I would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends, especially if you can get a good price on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Jen083
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were visiting a friend in Brooklyn and at the last minute, we decided to stay in Manhattan to be closer to restaurants and to Broadway (and to be a bit more comfortable too). We didn't want to spend a lot and tried using Priceline and got this hotel for $100 for 1 night compared to the $300 advertised! The hotel was a quick walk to Time Square and the staff were friendly and efficient. We had a king size bed and the room was clean and roomy enough for the 3 of us. The bathroom was clean. It was a great stay. We were also up on the 23rd floor and heard no street traffic or noise. The only complaint was that some of the TV channels were fuzzy, but we didn't go there to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior5209
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and affordable and best of all just a few blocks away from the heart of times square. I absolutely love their shampoo and conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: rhanahuey
Reviews.Content: I had to make a last minute reservation for a business trip during the week of all of the UN meetings (and the city was booked!) I stayed here as the prices were very reasonable considering the situation. You could tell the hotel had been recently remodeled (like all of their TV commercials say), and the room was great! The bed was super comfortable, and I slept like a baby. This is NYC, so the room was fairly small, but much bigger than other comparable hotels that I have stayed in. They had WIFI in the room that was very easy to access, all in all it was a great stay for the price! If you are looking for something convenient to the Times Square area, this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: readytobook
Reviews.Content: REally impressed with this hotel and location. Staff was very friendly. Arrived early about 11 am, and were able to check right in. Rooms were small as expected for NYC, but very, very clean. No long wait for elevators, as posted before. Breakfast is repetitious, would be nice if they alternated one day omelets, and sausage and next day scrambled eggs, and bacon, but it did the trick. Free internet to use, in lobby, if you can get on it. Street is busy during the day, but a little deserted at nighttime. Safe though. Liquor store and drug store on corner of 7th and 39th st, so that was handy. Cute restaurant around the corner on 8th st, Westway is the name. Great breakfast and so reasonable. Turn right out of hotel lobby, go right, at corner turn right and its at about 43rd st on right hand side. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “good position and not bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: ewp2326
Reviews.Content: Was clean and good service. Great position to see everything

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Primony
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, but with this being an almost new hotel you would expect that and unless your throwing a party in the room don't let that bother you. Spotless inside, and the bed is SOOOOO comfortable!! My wife was checking the comforter to see who made it lol! Great water pressure also, took a nice 30 min hot shower..something ya never do at home! It was about a 8 min walk to Times Square, but I'll walk the 5 or 6 blocks to save $250 a night! Elevators were somewhat slow, but it aint the Marriot. Get to the free breakfast by 8am and there's plenty of food and coffee to go around. Only negative thing is the parking. We had called and were told that there was parking for $50 a night. Not bad by NYC standards. On our first call we were told that we could drop off the car and they would park it in an off site lot. Then we were told when we got there that we would have to drop it off at IMPARK lot 5 min away and walk. Weather was nice but u might want to call and see if it was just us misunderstanding or a bad policy. So if your looking to save a couple hundred dollars a night, stay in a nice clean hotel that's close to TS then this is it. If your looking to stay in TS and like to spend $450 or more for a room to sleep in then pass on this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Oznar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to Port Authority bus terminal, times square, empire state. Very nice location...Rooms are small but clean, especially beds were very clean. Down side, someone ate chips and drunk sprite and left the empty boxes in the room. I asked the reception to check what happened but they never get back to me. I think one of the cleaning personal just watched TV in the room. I did not want to pursue more because I do not want someone to loose a job because of me. He/She did not touch any of my belongings

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel, affordable, many amenities”
Reviews.Author: h0rsewithn0name
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel offers - for a fairly low rate - large clean rooms, free wireless internet, a business center, and breakfast. It's centrally located (not the cleanest part of town), just a couple of minutes away from Times Square. Staff was ok. The only downside that I can think of are the elevator: although fast, there are two of them to serve the 36 storey building. Getting downstairs at check-out-rush-hour might take some 10 minutes.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square
